info.title: Musoni System REST API Reference
info.description:
Disclaimer

We are working towards documenting our APIs using the OpenAPI 3+ specification.

This documentation is BETA and subject to change.

Note: Older API documentation remains available from Legacy API Documentation for areas not covered in this OpenApi documentation.

Note: Usage of the API requires a user-specific api-key which can be requested via the Musoni Service Desk.

Musoni is a secure, multi-tenanted microfinance platform.

The goal of the Musoni API is to empower developers to build apps on top of the Musoni Platform.

The API is organized around REST and is designed to have:
  • predictable, resource-oriented URLs
  • to use HTTP response codes to indicate API errors
  • to use built-in HTTP features, like HTTP authentication and HTTP verbs, which can be understood by off-the-shelf HTTP clients.

JSON is returned in all responses from the API, including errors.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description:
An API capability that allows applications to peform authentication with platform using username password credentials. 

On success API will return details that support ability to call platform APIs using their supported security mechanism: HTTP Basic Authentication

tags.name: Multi-Factor Authentication
tags.description:
An API capability to support registration and use of multi-factor authentication (MFA) on users accounts.

Note: MFA cannot be enabled on Client Users (users where `isSelfServiceUser = true`)

tags.name: Users
tags.description:
An API capability to support administration of application users.

User accounts are setup so people or processes can authenticate before using APIs.

Users are associated with an office in the organisation. The platform data-scoping feature will limit what users can see and do based on their assigned office.

Users can be associated with a staff e.g loan officers

For self-service functionality users can be associated with a client allowing that user to login and view their account details.

tags.name: Roles
tags.description:
An API capability to support management of application roles for user administration.

Roles group together permissions. They are typically defined based on a persons role in a organisation or based on the functional access required.

tags.name: Permissions
tags.description:
An API capability to support management of application permissions for user administration.

Permissions come pre-installed as they are directly related to APIs. In order to be authorized to call an API a user must have its associated permission.

Note: We do not directly expose APIs for creation or deletion of permissions.

The update of a permissions is only in place to support the enabling or disabling of Maker-Checker functionality for command related (state changing) APIs.

tags.name: Password Preferences
tags.description:
This API enables management of password policy for user administration.

There is no Musoni functionality for creating a validation policy. The validation policies come pre-installed.

Validation policies may be updated

tags.name: Jobs
tags.description:
Jobs refers to a set of backend tasks that are performed and controlled by the Platform.

At any point, you can view the list of jobs scheduled to run along with other details specific to each job.

tags.name: Makercheckers
tags.description:
Maker checker functionality allows one user to create or modify an entry, and another user with "Checker" rights to inspect and approve the data. 

Checkers can only check and approve entries they are permitted to and that are within their data scope. 

'Head office' checkers can check and approve all entries, including those not office/branch related.

tags.name: Audits
tags.description:
Every Command API request is audited. A fully processed request can not be changed or deleted. See maker checker api for situations where an audit is not fully processed.

Permissions: To search and look at audit entries a user needs to be attached to a role that has one of the ALL_FUNCTIONS, ALL_FUNCTIONS_READ or READ_AUDIT permissions.

Data Scope: A user can only see audits that are within their data scope. However, 'head office' users can see all audits including those that aren't office/branch related e.g. Loan Product changes.

tags.name: Office
tags.description: Offices are used to model an MFIs structure. A hierarchical representation of offices is supported. There will always be at least least one office (which represents the MFI or an MFIs head office). All subsequent offices added must have a parent office.

tags.name: Staff
tags.description: Allows you to model staff members. At present the key role of significance is whether this staff member is a loan officer or not.

tags.name: Groups
tags.description:
Groups are used to provide a distinctive banking distribution channel used in microfinances throughout the world. \
The Group is an administrative unit. It can contain as few as 5 people or as many as 40 depending on how its used.

Different styles of group lending
- Joint-Liability Group
- Grameen Model (Center-Group),
- Self-Help Groups,
- Village/Communal Banks

tags.name: Clients
tags.description: Clients are people and businesses that have applied (or may apply) to an MFI for loans.

tags.name: Client Addresses
tags.description:
Client Addresses is an optional module that can be configured to be used with clients.

In order to activate Clients Address module, we need to enable the global configuration setting *enable-address* by setting its value to true.

tags.name: Client Charges
tags.description: It is typical for MFI's to directly associate charges with an implicit Client account. These can be either fees or penalties. Client Charges are client specific instances of Charges and payment or waive of these charges results in client transactions.

tags.name: Client Transactions
tags.description:
Client Transactions refer to transactions made directly againt a Client's internal account. 

Currently, these transactions are only created as a result of charge payments/waivers. 

You are allowed to undo a transaction, however you cannot explicitly create one.

tags.name: Client Identifiers
tags.description: Client Identifiers refer to documents that are used to uniquely identify a customer e.g. Drivers License, Passport, Ration card etc

tags.name: Blacklist
tags.description:
Blacklisting enables the ability to blacklist a client using different client identifiers e.g (National ID number).

The system will then block the creation of any client, savings account or loan account where any of these identifers are used.

tags.name: Collection Sheet
tags.description:
In microfinance its common for its financial services delivery to clients and groups to be performed by having staff members visit locations near the client/group.

Loan repayments and savings deposits are common transactions performed at these collections.

The collection sheet functionality is based on this and allows for a sheet to be generated with all the loan repayments and savings deposits that are expected to occur at the collection based on the groups/clients.

The view of transactions can be generated based on the office, group or staff member selected.

tags.name: Withdrawal Sheet
tags.description: Similiar to the collection sheet concept but this approach allows for saving withdrawal transactions to be performed in bulk based on the office, staff, group.

tags.name: Loan Product
tags.description:
A loan product is used to describe a product offering related to loans that an orgnaisation provides.

All settings and features related to loans can be enabled or configured here. 

The product definition then acts as a template that simplifies loan account creation as the loan account will inherit the properties set in the product definition.

Updates to the product definition to not apply to loan accounts already created against the product definition; they apply only to the definition itself and future loan accounts created against it.

tags.name: Savings Product
tags.description:
Savings accounts support features that allow the accounts to be used as typical savings accounts or as every day accounts like current/checking accounts:

- Application process: for group or individual clients
- Transactions: Ability to deposit and withdraw from account
- Charges: fees or penalties can be setup
- Accounting: cash based accounting for transactions on account
- Interest 
  - Rates: can be described via interest rate charts or as simple APR
  - Calculation
  - Posting
  - Witholding Tax (applied to interest postings)
  - Transfer of interest to seperate linked account
- States
  - Dormancy
  - Escheat
- Support for restrictions around:
  - Minimum opening balance
  - Minimum balance
  - Lock-in

tags.name: FTD Product
tags.description:
Fixed Term Deposit are specialised savings accounts and support the following features:

- Charges: fees or penalties can be setup
- Accounting: cash based accounting for transactions on account
- Deposit amount and term ranges
- Term lock-in
- Pre-Closure: support for pre-closure with or without penalty
- Auto Renewal: configure to auto renew on Maturity
- Interest Rates: can be described via multi-slab charts or as simple APR
- Interest Calculation
- Interest Posting and Witholding Tax
- Transfer of interest to seperate linked account

tags.name: Account Transfers
tags.description:
Enables the transfer of monetary funds from one account to another.

At present the following account transfers are supported:
- Savings to Savings 
- Savings to Fixed Term Deposit
- Savings to Loan
- Loan to Savings

tags.name: Standing Instructions
tags.description:
Standing instructions (aka standing orders) refer to instructions an account holder ("the payer")
gives to his or her financial institute to pay a set amount at regular intervals to another's ("the payee's") account.

At present the following scenarios support standing instructions:
- Account Transfer from savings account to savings account
- Loan Repayment from savings account to loan Account
- Share repurchase from savings account to share account

tags.name: General Ledger Account
tags.description:
General ledger accounts (GL Accounts) represent an individual account within an organizations Chart Of Accounts (COA).

They are assigned a name and unique number by which they can be identified. \
All transactions relating to a company's assets, liabilities, equity, income or expense are recorded against these accounts.

tags.name: Accounting
tags.description:
Journal entries and general accounting operations for the microfinance platform.

Journal entries represent double-entry bookkeeping transactions that maintain the integrity
of the general ledger. All financial transactions are recorded as journal entries with
balanced debits and credits.

Key features include:
- Manual and automated journal entry creation
- Running balance calculations (office and organization level)
- Journal entry reversal and reconciliation
- Opening balance management
- Multi-currency support

tags.name: Financial Activity Accounts
tags.description:
Financial activity accounts represent a mapping between financial activity and a general ledger account.

Financial activities are system-defined activities that require a corresponding GL Account for accounting purposes. 

This mapping ensures that transactions related to a specific financial activity are correctly posted to the designated GL Account.

For example asset and liability transfers can be mapped to GL Account and then the accounting module takes these GL accounts into consideration when account transfers are made between loan and savings accounts.

tags.name: Accounting Exports
tags.description: Accounting exports are custom defined export formats towards 3rd party accounting systems such as SQL Accounting, SUN6, Sage and others.

tags.name: GL Closures
tags.description: Accounting closures are used to close the books for a specific office up to a certain date, preventing further transactions before that date.

tags.name: Accounting Rules
tags.description:
It is a typical scenario in MFI's that non accountants pass journal entries on a regular basis. e.g A branch office might deposit their entire cash at hand to their Bank account at the end of a working day. The branch office users might not understand enough of accounting to figure out which account needs to get credited and which account needs to be debited to represent this transaction.

Enter accounting rules (known as Journal Templates on Musoni web ui), an abstraction on top of manual Journal entires for enabling simpler data entry. 

An accounting rule can define any of the following abstractions:
- A Simple journal entry where both the credit and debit account have been preselected
- A Simple journal entry where either credit or debit accounts have been limited to a pre-selected list of accounts (Ex: Debit account should be one of "Bank of America" of "JP Morgan" and credit account should be "Cash")
- A Compound journal entry where multiple debits and / or multiple credits may be made amongst a set of preselected list of accounts (Ex: Credit account should be either "Bank Of America" or "Cash" and debit account can be "Employee Salary" and/or "Miscellenous Expenses")

tags.name: Accruals
tags.description: Periodic Accrual is to accrue the loan income till the specific date or till batch job scheduled time.

tags.name: Batches
tags.description: Batch API calls are used to group together API calls in one request, creating hierarchy, passing on paramaters and with (optional) rollback capabilities if any of the nested calls fails.

tags.name: Data Exports
tags.description: Data Exports are used to generate exports of data from tables linked to a specified base entity

tags.name: Data Filters
tags.description: The Data Filter API supports the ability to produce filtered views of a modelled entity (Metadata Model). These filtered views are highly customisable through rules expression support, multi-sort and ability to define the fields included in response. The filter definition can then be saved and executed on demand. See The Metadata API for listing of models supported.

tags.name: Datatables (Schema)
tags.description:
Datatables functionality enables dynamic user-defined relational tables that can be associated with existing core resources (clients, loans, etc.).

They allow for extending the data model on a tenant basis without modifying the core schema.

This API enables creating and managing datatable definitions.

tags.name: Datatables (Usage)
tags.description:
APIs for working with datatable entries.

Datatables can have two types of relationships with core resources:
- One-to-one: A single datatable entry per core resource record
- One-to-many: Multiple datatable entries per core resource record

This API enables adding, updating, and retrieving datatable entries.

tags.name: Survey
tags.description: Enhances the datatables functionality to support surveys

tags.name: Entity Datatable Checks
tags.description:
APIs for managing validation rules through entity datatable checks.

Entity datatable checks are used to enforce validation rules for datatables at specific stages of an entity's lifecycle.

tags.name: Document Templates
tags.description:
Document templates (a.k.a User Generated Documents) can be used to generate customised documents as loan contracts, repayment schedules etc. 

Document templates use Mustache templates with various handlebars helper extensions to allow more advanced operations.

tags.name: Credit Bureaus
tags.description: The creditbureaus api allows access to creditbureau data stored in Musoni through pre-integrated CRB providers.

tags.name: Search
tags.description: Search API allows scoped search across portfolio resources suchs as clients, groups, loans and savings.

tags.name: Webhooks
Reports
tags.description:
API for managing reports, including core and non-core reports, parameterized queries, and UI visibility.

Core reports (supplied at installation/upgrade time) can only have their "useReport" updated. "useReport" is used, for example, in the reference UI report page to 'show'/'not show' reports. Reports that have useReport set to false can still be run. Reports only used for workflow purposes are examples of reports that would have their useReport set to false.

Placeholders can be put in the reportSql to act as parameters. They have the format ${paramName}. The runreports api will translate the value of any query parameter beginning R_ with the equivalent placeholder.
e.g. query parameter R_myName=john will replace ${myName} with john

There is a special 'automatic' placeholder ${currentUserHierarchy} - if this is included in reportSql it gets replaced by the requesting users' office hierarchy value. This enables data scoping.
Usage example "where o.hierarchy like CONCAT('${currentUserHierarchy}', '%')"

Note:
The reports api allows parameters (not just placeholders in reportSql) to be associated with reports. These associated parameters are only required to allow the reference UI reporting functionality implement user-friendly parameter input.

tags.name: Run Reports
tags.description: Supports the ability to execute reports either on-demand or via queue based processing.

tags.name: Funds
tags.description: API for managing funds. Funds are used to categorize and track sources of money within the system.

tags.name: Currencies
tags.description: API for managing currency configuration.

tags.name: Working Days
tags.description:
Represents the days of the week that are workdays and configuration around strategy to use if a repayment falls on a working day.

configuration related to workdays (see Global configurations):
  - `reschedule-future-repayments` indicates how rescheduling of repayments should be processed when it falls on a non-working day
  - `allow-transactions-on-non_workingday` allows transactions on non-working days if enabled

tags.name: Holidays
tags.description:
API for managing holidays within the Musoni system. Holidays can be defined for specific offices and can impact loan repayment schedules.

Key functionalities include:
- Creating new holidays with details such as name, description, start and end dates, and a designated date for rescheduling repayments that fall within the holiday period.
- Retrieving a list of all defined holidays, with the option to filter by office.
- Retrieving detailed information for a specific holiday.
- Updating the details of an existing holiday.
- Deleting a holiday.

Holidays play a crucial role in the loan module by influencing repayment dates. The system provides configuration options to manage how holidays affect transactions and repayment rescheduling.

tags.name: Payment Types
tags.description: Payment types are used to categorize how payments are made within the system (e.g., cash, mobile money, bank transfer).

tags.name: Codes
tags.description:
Code and code values: Codes represent a specific category of data, their code values are a specific instance of that category.

Codes are mostly system defined which means the code itself comes out of the box and cannot be modified however its code values can be. e.g. 'Customer Identifier', it defaults to a code value of 'Passport' but could be 'Drivers License, National Id' etc

tags.name: Code Values
tags.description:
Code and code values: Codes represent a specific category of data, their code values are a specific instance of that category.

Codes are mostly system defined which means the code itself comes out of the box and cannot be modified however its code values can be. e.g. 'Customer Identifier', it defaults to a code value of 'Passport' but could be 'Drivers License, National Id' etc

post.description:
Authenticates username password credentials.

If multi-factor authentication is enabled then a secondary security token will be requested once username, password are verified.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username to authenticate with.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password to use with `username` for authentication.

200.description: Returns a response on authentication success.

username.description: The `username` of the user account associated with the authenticated username.

userId.description: The `id` of the user account associated with the authenticated username.

base64EncodedAuthenticationKey.description: A base 64 encoded key that can be used with HTPP Basic Authentication on all subsequent API calls.

authenticated.description: Indicates if user is authenticated or not.

officeId.description: The `id` of the office this user is associated with.

officeName.description: The `name` of the office this user is associated with.

staffId.description: The `id` of the staff this user is associated with.

staffDisplayName.description: The `displayName` of the staff this user is associated with.

roles.description: An array that lists all permission codes of all permissions associated with this users roles.

permissions.description: An array that lists all permission codes of all permissions associated with this users roles.

shouldRenewPassword.description: Indicates if user should be asked to change their password

renewPasswordOnNextLogin.description: Indicates if this users password is due to be changed. On next login user will be requested to change their password.

isSelfServiceUser.description: Indicates if this user is setup as a self-service user.

clients.description: If `isSelfServiceUser`, clients will be returned indicating what client(s) this self-service user is associated with.

accountNo.description: The unique account number for this client.

displayname.description: The name of the client as it will be displayed.

isStaff.description: Indicates if this client is also a staff member

tags.description: Tags related to this client.

401.description: Unauthorized access. Auth credentials not provided or invalid.

developerMessage.description: A natural language message more suitable for developers that conusme API.
developerMessage.example: Invalid authentication details were passed in api request.

defaultUserMessage.description: Application user friendly error message in english describing issue.

errors.description: Specific errors relating to this error

post.description:
Registers the user account of user making request for MFA.

This involves auto generating a secret and proving a QR code back that end user can use to register with a device.

Note: MFA cannot be enabled on Client Users (users where `isSelfServiceUser = true`)

email.description: The `email` of the user account registered.

username.description: The `username` of the user account registered.

mfaSecret.description:
A unique code that is generated on registration. 

This is the only time this secret will be shared. 

It can be used to setup an account with auth apps such as "Twilo Authy" or the more convienent QR Code approach can be taken by `qrCodeImageDataUri`.

qrCodeImageDataUri.description: A unique QR code that is available on registration based on the `mfaSecret`. This string is in a format that html image tag is able to render `` This is the only time this QR code will be shared. It can be used to setup an account with auth apps such as "Twilo Authy" using a devices camera function or the `mfaSecret` can also be manually input.

post.description:
Validates a provided `mfaToken` against the users MFA setup.

Two successful validation requests with different `mfaToken`s are required in order to complete MFA registration.

Note: MFA cannot be enabled on Client Users (users where `isSelfServiceUser = true`)

parameters.name: mfaToken
parameters.description:
The code provided by the device where mfa account was setup.

Typically configured to return a six digit pin but can be different.

isValid.description: Indicates if the validation request was successful or not.

mfa.description: Provides the current state of the mfa setup for the user account in use.

enabled.description: Indicates if MFA is enabled on the user account

registered.description:
Indicates if MFA registration is fully complete on the user account. 

This will remain `false` until two successful validation requests are recorded with different `mfaToken`s.

codeExpired.description: if `true`, indicates that mfa verification is required for this user account.

post.description:
Validates a MFA code (`mfaToken`) against the users MFA setup.

Note: MFA cannot be enabled on Client Users (users where `isSelfServiceUser = true`)

parameters.name: mfaToken
parameters.description:
The code provided by the device where mfa account was setup.

Typically configured to return a six digit pin but can be different.

isValid.description: Indicates if the validation request was successful or not.

mfa.description: Provides the current state of the mfa setup for the user account in use.

enabled.description: Indicates if MFA is enabled on the user account

registered.description:
Indicates if MFA registration is fully complete on the user account. 

This will remain `false` until two successful validation requests are recorded with different `mfaToken`s.

codeExpired.description: if `true`, indicates that mfa verification is required for this user account.

get.description:
Returns all non-deleted users.

Permission: READ_USER

200.description:
Returns non-paged response of Users that satisfy the request. 

You will always get a `200 status code` response to show success even if there are zero items returned.

post.description:
Creates a new user account.

Permission: CREATE_USER

get.description: Find User by id

put.description:
Support ability to update details of user account.

Note: When updating a password you must provide the repeatPassword parameter also.

post.description:
Supports multi-factor authentication (MFA) related commands on a user.

Note: MFA cannot be enabled on Client Users (users where `isSelfServiceUser = true`)

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: The name of the command being performed.

delete.description:
Performs a soft delete of the user.

Any requests to find this user or operate on the user will result in a 404 not found as the resource no longer exists.

get.description: List all Roles

parameters.name: activeRoleOnly
parameters.description: if true, returns all active roles

200.description:
Returns non-paged response of items that satisfy the request. 

You will always get a `200 status code` response to show success even if there are zero items returned.

post.description: Creates a new role which can then be updated with permissions.

get.description: Find Role member by id

put.description: Supports the ability to update role details.

post.description: Supports enable and disable commands on a role

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: The name of the command being performed.

delete.description: Will perform hard delete of the role unless it is associated with any users.

get.description: List permissions assocatied with role

put.description: The ability to be able to update what permissions are associated with this role.

get.description:
If `makerCheckerable=false` or not supplied then a list of permissions is returned. The `selected` attribute is always true in this case.

If `makerCheckerable=true` then returns all permissions that can be enabled for maker-checker (which excludes read permissions or special permissions). The `selected` attribute shows whether the permission is enabled for Maker-Checker.

Note: Each Musoni transaction is associated with a permission.

parameters.name: makerCheckerable
parameters.description: boolean to indicate what way to list permissions

200.description:
Returns non-paged response of items that satisfy the request. 

You will always get a `200 status code` response to show success even if there are zero items returned.

put.description: Allows permissions to be updated to enable/disable maker-checker for them.

requestBody.description: Allows permissions to be updated to enable/disable maker-checker for them.

get.description: Lists all the active system validation policies.

200.description:
Returns non-paged response of items that satisfy the request. 

You will always get a `200 status code` response to show success even if there are zero results returned.

put.description: The ability to update the selected active validation policy for user accounts.

get.description: Lists all system validation policies.

200.description:
Returns non-paged response of items that satisfy the request. 

You will always get a `200 status code` response to show success even if there are zero results returned.

get.description:
Returns all jobs configured with the scheduler.

Permission: READ_SCHEDULER

200.description:
Returns non-paged response that satisfy the request. 

You will always get a `200 status code` response to show success even if there are zero items returned.

get.description:
Returns details of the job

Permission: READ_SCHEDULER

post.description:
Manually execute the job.

Warning

Jobs in this system are automatically triggered as part of standard operations and do not require manual execution. Manually triggering jobs can lead to data inconsistencies and performance issues due to incorrect execution order. Proceed only if you fully understand the impact. For assistance, contact the support team.

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: The executeJob command.

get.description:
Returns the history of job executions for a specific job.

Permission: READ_SCHEDULER

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The SQL,Database name of the field

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: DESC or ASC

200.description:
Returns paged response of items that satisfy the request. 

You will always get a `200 status code` response to show success even if there are zero results returned.

get.description:
Search all collection sheet submissions that are "processed" or "rejected".

Collection sheet submissions that are still "awaiting approval" are not returned.

parameters.name: officeId
parameters.description:
The id of an office. 

Filters the search to only collection sheets associated with this offices hierarchy (office + sub-offices).

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description:
The id of a group.

Filters the search to only collection sheets associated with this group.

parameters.name: makerId
parameters.description:
The id of an application user that created the collection sheet. 

Filters the search to only collection sheets created by this user.

parameters.name: makerDateTimeFrom
parameters.description:
Filter by maker date time from (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss).
Example: `2013-03-25 08:00:00`

parameters.name: makerDateTimeTo
parameters.description:
Filter by maker date time to (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss).
Example: `2013-04-04 18:00:00`

200.description:
Returns non-paged response of records that satisfy the request.

You will always get a `200 status code` response to show success even if there are zero records returned.

post.description: Generates a collection sheet view based on parameters provided.

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: The generateGroupCollectionSheet command.

200.description:
Returns non-paged response of records that satisfy the request.

You will always get a `200 status code` response to show success even if there are zero records returned.

post.description: Generates a collection sheet view based on parameters provided.

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: The generateCollectionSheet command.

200.description:
Returns non-paged response of records that satisfy the request.

You will always get a `200 status code` response to show success even if there are zero records returned.

post.description: Submits a collection sheet based on parameters provided.

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: The saveGroupCollectionSheet command.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: The id of a group.

200.description: Returns response indicating the collection was successfuly submitted

commandId.description: The id of the collection sheet audit entry

post.description: Approves a collection sheet submission resulting in processing of transactions

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: The approve command.

parameters.name: commandId
parameters.description: The id of the audit entry of the collection submission

200.description: Returns response indicating the collection was successfuly submitted

commandId.description: The id of the collection sheet audit entry

resourceId.description: The id of the collection sheet

locale.description: The locale to use when interpreting number and date fields in the request.

dateFormat.description: The date format to use when interpreting date fields in the request. Must be suported by Joda Time.

note.description: The value of the note on collection sheet if provided

status.description: The status of the collection sheet process

id.description: the id of the status enum

code.description: the internationalized code of status enum

value.description: the english value of status enum

loanTransactions.description: This array is populated with ids of all successful loan repayment transactions

loanRepaymentErrors.description: This array is populated with ids of all the failing loan repayment transactions

failedLoanIds.description: This array is populated with ids of all loans with failing transactions

SavingsTransactions.description: This array is populated with ids of all successful savings deposit transactions

savingsDepositErrors.description: This array is populated with ids of all the failing savings deposit transactions

failedSavingsIds.description: This array is populated with ids of all savings accounts with failing transactions

get.description:
Search all withdrawal sheet submissions that are "processed" or "rejected".

Withdrawal sheet submissions that are still "awaiting approval" are not returned.

parameters.name: officeId
parameters.description:
The id of an office. 

Filters the search to only collection sheets associated with this offices hierarchy (office + sub-offices).

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description:
The id of a group.

Filters the search to only collection sheets associated with this group.

parameters.name: makerId
parameters.description:
The id of an application user that created the collection sheet. 

Filters the search to only collection sheets created by this user.

parameters.name: makerDateTimeFrom
parameters.description:
Filter by maker date time from (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss).
Example: `2013-03-25 08:00:00`

parameters.name: makerDateTimeTo
parameters.description:
Filter by maker date time to (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss).

get.description: List all Groups See The Data Filter API for better approach for search/filter.

parameters.name: paged
parameters.description: Defaults to `false`. If set to `true` then results will be paginated.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Performs a partial matching search across the follow properties of Group to see if they contain the search term:
- display_name
- account_no
- external_id

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Deprecated and not used. Use `sortBy` instead.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Deprecated and not used. Use `sortBy` instead.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Expects a valid SQL fragment that used in `order by` section of SQL statement.

e.g. \
g.account_no DESC \
g.display_name DESC

parameters.name: officeId
parameters.description: The id of an office. Used to restrict to the set of groups associated with this offices hierarchy (office + sub-offices).

parameters.name: underHierarchy
parameters.description:
if provided only groups that exist on or under the office hierarchy provided will be returned.

This parameter overrides any data-scoping that is performed against the current users office hierarchy allowing the user to fetch groups not in their office hierarchy.

Note: Do not place single or double quotes around the value.

parameters.name: staffId
parameters.description: The id of an staff (loanofficer).  Used to restrict to the set of groups associated with the staff.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Use name of groups to restrict results using exact match.

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: Use externalId of groups to restrict results using exact match.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Used to restrict the search to groups whoose status (code) matches the status code provided.

parameters.name: modifiedSinceTimestamp
parameters.description:
Should be passed as a UNIX Timestamp. 

When provided only groups that have been created or updated since the provided timestamp are returned.

Groups will be marked as modified whenever there is any modification to the group.

This parameter can be used in integrations to fetch changed data since a last fetch, timestamps will be treated as UTC and returned as UTC.

parameters.name: orphansOnly
parameters.description:
Deprecated. To be removed.

Set to `true` to list groups which are not associated to any center or parent group.

Center or parents groups are not support on musoni system applications.

parameters.name: sqlSearch
parameters.description: Deprecated. Use other parameters such as `search` or See The Data Filter API for better approach for search/filter. Expects a valid SQL fragment that used in `where` section of SQL statement. e.g. \ display_name like '%K%' \ g.account_no like '0033-%'

200.description:
Returns non-paged response of Offices that satisfy the request.

You will always get a `200 status code` response to show success even if there are zero Offices returned.

get.description: Ability to search and list clients using parameters provided. See The Data Filter API for better approach to search/filter.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Performs a partial matching search across the following properties of Client to see if they contain the search term:
- account_no
- external_id
- firstname
- middlename
- lastname
- display_name
- Group display_name

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The SQL,Database name of the field

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: DESC or ASC

parameters.name: officeId
parameters.description: The id of an office. Used to restrict to set of clients associated with the office.

parameters.name: staffId
parameters.description: The id of a staff member. Used to restrict to set of clients associated with the staff member.

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description:
The externalId of a client. Used to restrict to set of clients where external id is like provided value.
e.g. ABC-123% will find all clients that have externalId starting with ABC-123

parameters.name: displayName
parameters.description:
The display name of a client. Used to restrict to set of clients where display name is like provided value.
e.g. john will find all clients that have display name with text 'john'

parameters.name: firstname
parameters.description:
The first name of a client. Used to restrict to set of clients where first name is like provided value.
e.g. john will find all clients that have first name with text 'john'

parameters.name: lastname
parameters.description:
The last name of a client. Used to restrict to set of clients where last name is like provided value.
e.g. smith will find all clients that have last name with text 'smith'

parameters.name: hierarchy
parameters.description:
The textual representation of the office hierarchy of a client. 

Used to restrict to set of clients where their office hierarchy is like provided value.
e.g. '.2' will find all clients that have hierarchy starting with '.2'

parameters.name: modifiedSinceTimestamp
parameters.description:
Should be passed as a UNIX Timestamp. 

When provided only clients that have been created or updated since the provided timestamp are returned.

Clients will be marked as modified whenever there is any modification to the client.

This parameter can be used in integrations to fetch changed data since a last fetch, timestamps will be treated as UTC and returned as UTC.

parameters.name: orphansOnly
parameters.description: Use orphansOnly as true to list clients which are not associated to any group/parent.

parameters.name: sqlSearch
parameters.description: Deprecated. Use other parameters such as `search` or See The Data Filter API for better approach for search/filter. A valid sql fragment that will work with backend query for this api. If `staffInOfficeHierarchy` is false, and when supplied it will be used in the backend SQL Query where clause to restrict set of staff return.

200.description:
Returns paged response of clients that satisfy the request.

You will always get a `200 status code` response to show success even if there are zero Loans returned.

post.description:
The supported schema for creating a new client. 

`officeId` is mandatory when creating a client \
`fullname` or any of `firstname`, `middlename`, `lastname` must be provided as name for client \
`active` must be provided when creating a client, if true its possible client creation will fail if it is a member of a group and breaks group rules. \
`dateFormat` and `locale` are required even with no date fields at present. \

get.description: Find a client by id

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: if true, returns all active staff in office hierarchy that are above the provided `officeId`.

parameters.name: staffInSelectedOfficeOnly
parameters.description:
'Only relevant if `template` is true. 

If true, returns all active staff in office hierarchy associated with this client.'

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: Indications what additional details to bring back from areas associated with client

put.description:
The supported schema for updating a new client. 

`dateFormat` and `locale` are required even with no date fields at present. \

get.description:
List all blacklist entries.

A blacklist entry is made up of `documentType` and `documentKey`. 

The `documentType` relates to a Client Identifier Type setup and the `documentKey` is the value of it e.g. National ID and National ID number or Passport and Passport number. 

The blacklist is used by account creation and approval APIs to verify the related client or account is not blacklisted.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description:
Expects a valid SQL fragment that is used in `order by` section of SQL statement.

e.g. \
bl.document_type_id \
bl.document_key

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Used with `orderyBy` to sort the results in the specified direction.

If `orderyBy` is not provided this parameter is ignored.

200.description: Returns paged response of blacklist entries that satisfy the request.

totalFilteredRecords.description: The count of all items that match the request.

pageItems.description: An array of results representing the current page.

post.description:
Adds an new entry to blacklist.

A blacklist entry is made up of `documentTypeId` and `documentKey`. 

The `documentTypeId` relates to a Client Identifier Type setup and the `documentKey` is the value of it e.g. National ID and National ID number or Passport and Passport number. 

The blacklist is used by account creation and approval APIs to verify the related client or account is not blacklisted.

put.description: Update an existing blacklist entry.

delete.description:
Delete an existing blacklist entry.

The deletion is a soft delete, marking the entry as not active.

post.description:
Blacklist an existing Client.

The process takes the Client Identifier Types associated with the existing client and adds them to the blacklist.

This has the effect of blacklisting the client.

parameters.description:
Searches (matching around) across:
- Group name
- Staff name
- Client name
- Loan product name
- Loan account number
- Outstanding loan amount (if search is a number)
- Loan principal Disbursed (if search is a number)
- Disbursement date (if search is a date)

parameters.name: officeId
parameters.description: The id of an office. Used to restrict to set of staff associated with the office.

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: if provided only loans with this exact externalId will be returned

parameters.name: staffId
parameters.description: id of a staff/loanofficer, if provided will only return the loans linked to this staff id

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: id of a staff/loanofficer, if provided will only return the loans linked to this staff id

parameters.name: underHierarchy
parameters.description: if provided only loans that exist under the hierarchy provided will be return (office + child offices)

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The database field name that you wish to order the list of loans by.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Used with `orderBy` parameter, this indicates the sorting order of the attribute mentioned in `orderBy`. This parameter is ignored unless `orderBy` is provided also.

parameters.name: accountNo
parameters.description: if provided only loans with this exact accountNo will be returned

parameters.name: skipRowCount
parameters.description: if true, does not return rowcount, improving search speed.

parameters.name: disbursementFromDate
parameters.description: Allows to only return a subset of loans based on disbursement date, should be provided in format  "yyyy-MM-dd"

parameters.name: disbursementToDate
parameters.description: Allows to only return a subset of loans based on disbursement date, should be provided in format  "yyyy-MM-dd"

parameters.name: clientOfficeName
parameters.description: Only returns loans that are part of an exact office name.

parameters.name: modifiedSinceTimestamp
parameters.description:
Should be passed as a UNIX Timestamp. 

When provided only loans that have been created or updated since the provided timestamp are returned.

Loans will be marked as modified whenever there is any modification to the loan, the underlying schedule, transactions, charges etc.

This parameter can be used in integrations to fetch changed data since a last fetch, timestamps will be treated as UTC and returned as UTC.

get.description:
Retrieves journal entries with extensive filtering and pagination capabilities.

Journal entries represent double-entry bookkeeping transactions in the general ledger.
Each entry records debits and credits to ensure balanced accounting.

**Parameter Requirements:**
- Either `officeId` or `glAccountId` must be provided to filter the results

**Key Features:**
- Running balance calculations (office and organization level)
- Manual vs auto-generated entry filtering
- Transaction association support
- Reconciliation status tracking
- Portfolio item integration (loans, savings, shares)

**User Notes:**
- Office running balance: calculated using transactions from the same branch only
- Organization running balance: calculated using transactions from all branches
- Date range is limited to one month for performance reasons
- Branch filtering: Head Office shows only Head Office entries, not sub-branches
- To view all entries for a date range, don't select any branch filter

parameters.name: officeId
parameters.description: Filter journal entries by office/branch (required if glAccountId is not provided)

parameters.name: glAccountId
parameters.description: Filter journal entries by GL account (required if officeId is not provided)

parameters.name: manualEntriesOnly
parameters.description: Filter to show only manual journal entries (excludes auto-generated entries)

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Start date for filtering journal entries (format depends on dateFormat parameter)

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: End date for filtering journal entries (format depends on dateFormat parameter)

parameters.name: createdFromDate
parameters.description: Start date for filtering by creation date

parameters.name: createdToDate
parameters.description: End date for filtering by creation date

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: Filter journal entries by transaction ID

parameters.name: entityType
parameters.description: Filter journal entries by entity type (1=Client, 2=Group, 3=Loan, 4=Savings, 5=Center, 6=Share)

parameters.name: loanId
parameters.description: Filter journal entries by loan account ID

parameters.name: savingsId
parameters.description: Filter journal entries by savings account ID

parameters.name: shareId
parameters.description: Filter journal entries by share account ID

parameters.name: runningBalance
parameters.description: Include running balance calculations in response

parameters.name: transactionDetails
parameters.description: Include transaction details in response

parameters.name: notes
parameters.description: Include notes/comments in response

parameters.name: paymentDetails
parameters.description: Include payment details in response

parameters.name: isReconciled
parameters.description: Filter by reconciliation status (0=Not reconciled, 1=Reconciled)

parameters.name: refNumber
parameters.description: Filter journal entries by reference number

parameters.name: searchTerm
parameters.description: General search term for filtering journal entries

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Field to order results by

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Sort order for results

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale for formatting numbers and dates

parameters.name: dateFormat
parameters.description: Date format for parsing date parameters

totalFilteredRecords.description: Total number of records matching the filter criteria

post.description:
Creates a new balanced journal entry in the general ledger.

Journal entries must follow double-entry bookkeeping principles where total debits equal total credits.
The system will validate that the journal entry balances before accepting it.

**Business Rules:**
- Total debit amounts must equal total credit amounts
- All journal entries must have at least one debit and one credit
- Manual journal entries can be created for adjustments and corrections
- Office and date must be specified for proper data scoping

get.description:
Retrieves a specific journal entry by its ID.

Returns detailed information about a single journal entry including transaction details,
running balances, and associated metadata.

parameters.name: entryId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the journal entry

parameters.name: runningBalance
parameters.description: Include running balance calculations in response

parameters.name: transactionDetails
parameters.description: Include transaction details in response

post.description:
Performs operations on journal entries including reversal and reconciliation.

**Reverse Operation (command=reverse):**
- Creates new journal entries that exactly offset the original entries
- Effectively reverses the accounting impact while maintaining an audit trail
- Only non-reversed journal entries can be reversed
- Reversal creates new entries with opposite debit/credit values
- Original entries are marked as reversed but remain in the system

**Reconcile Operation (command=reconcile):**
- Marks journal entries as reconciled for bank reconciliation purposes
- Updates the reconciliation status of the journal entry

parameters.name: entryId
parameters.description: The transaction ID of the journal entry to process

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: Command to execute on the journal entry

value.developerMessage: Journal entry with transaction ID TXN123456 is already reversed
value.defaultUserMessage: This journal entry has already been reversed.

get.description: List paged response of tasks matching filter criteria. The API is scoped by user permissions setup: - A user with `READ_TASK_ADMIN` permission is allowed to search tasks assigned / createdby other users so long as in its office hierarchy. - A user with `READ_TASK` permission is allowed to search tasks either assigned or created by them so long as in office hierarchy. - A user with no task permissions is allowed to view tasks where they are the created by user (and the assigned to user if used in search). See The Data Filter API for better approach for search/filter.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: Restrict response to tasks with client id matching this value.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Restrict response to tasks with group id matching this value.

parameters.name: modifiedSinceTimestamp
parameters.description:
Should be passed as a UNIX Timestamp. 

When provided only tasks that have been created or updated since the provided timestamp are returned.

Whenever a task is modified its last modified date and time in UTC is captured.

This parameter can be used in integrations to fetch changed data since a last fetch, timestamps will be treated as UTC and returned as UTC.

parameters.name: statusId
parameters.description: Restrict response to tasks with status matching this value.

parameters.name: priorityId
parameters.description: Restrict response to tasks with priority matching this value.

parameters.name: completed
parameters.description: Restrict response to tasks whose `completed` attribute match this value.

parameters.name: taskAssignedToUserId
parameters.description: Restrict response to tasks assigned to users matching this value.

parameters.name: taskCreatedByUserId
parameters.description: Restrict response to tasks created by users matching this value.

parameters.name: dueDateFrom
parameters.description:
This parameter must also be used with `dueDateTo` to provide range otherwise it is ignored.

Restrict response to tasks where due date is in range `dueDateFrom` to `dueDateTo`.

The date can be in ISO format yyyy-MM-dd or in the format specified by dateFormat parameter

parameters.name: dueDateTo
parameters.description:
This parameter must also be used with `dueDateFrom` to provide range otherwise it is ignored.

Restrict response to tasks where due date is in range `dueDateFrom` to `dueDateTo`.

The date can be in ISO format yyyy-MM-dd or in the format specified by dateFormat parameter

parameters.name: createdDateFrom
parameters.description:
This parameter must also be used with `createdDateTo` to provide range otherwise it is ignored.

Restrict response to tasks where its created date is in range `createdDateFrom` to `createdDateTo`.

The date can be in ISO format yyyy-MM-dd or in the format specified by dateFormat parameter

parameters.name: createdDateTo
parameters.description:
This parameter must also be used with `createdDateFrom` to provide range otherwise it is ignored.

Restrict response to tasks where its created date is in range `createdDateFrom` to `createdDateTo`.

The date can be in ISO format yyyy-MM-dd or in the format specified by dateFormat parameter

parameters.name: completedOnDateFrom
parameters.description:
This parameter must also be used with `completedOnDateTo` to provide range otherwise it is ignored.

Restrict response to tasks where its completed on date is in range `completedOnDateFrom` to `completedOnDateTo`.

The date can be in ISO format yyyy-MM-dd or in the format specified by dateFormat parameter

parameters.name: completedOnDateTo
parameters.description:
This parameter must also be used with `completedOnDateFrom` to provide range otherwise it is ignored.

Restrict response to tasks where its completed on date is in range `completedOnDateFrom` to `completedOnDateTo`.

The date can be in ISO format yyyy-MM-dd or in the format specified by dateFormat parameter

parameters.name: dateFormat
parameters.description: If provided, then it will be used in formatting date parameters, else the date parameters must be in ISO format yyyy-MM-dd

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The api parameter name of field you wish to order by.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Used with `orderBy` parameter, this indicates the sorting order of the attribute mentioned in `orderBy`. This parameter is ignored unless `orderBy` is provided also.

200.description:
Returns paged response of tasks that satisfy the request.

You will always get a `200 status code` response to show success even if there are zero tasks returned.

post.description: Batching allows a consumer to pass instructions for several operations in a single HTTP request. A consumer can also specify dependencies between related operations. Once all operations have been completed, a consolidated response will be passed back and the HTTP connection will be closed. The Batch API takes in an array of logical HTTP requests represented as JSON arrays - each request has a requestId (the id of a request used to specify the sequence and as a dependency between requests), a method (corresponding to HTTP method GET/PUT/POST/DELETE etc.), a relativeUrl (the portion of the URL after https://example.org/api/v2/), optional headers array (corresponding to HTTP headers), optional reference parameter if a request is dependent on another request and an optional body (for POST and PUT requests). The Batch API returns an array of logical HTTP responses represented as JSON arrays - each response has a requestId, a status code, an optional headers array and an optional body (which is a JSON encoded string). Batch API uses Json Path to handle dependent parameters. For example, if request '2' is referencing request '1' and in the "body" or in "relativeUrl" of request '2', there is a dependent parameter (which will look like "$.parameter_name"), then Batch API will internally substitute this dependent parameter from the response body of request '1'. Batch calls are currently supported for the following API calls: - clients - clients - groups - savingsaccounts - tasks - users - loans - makercheckers - collectionsheet - datatables/{table}/{entity} NB: If any API call where batching is preferred is missing from this list, please report this to the Musoni Service Desk.

Retrieve outbound SMS messages from the Musoni API.  
These messages can then be forwarded to any third-party SMS gateway for delivery â for example, Infobip, Twilio, or another provider â using the accompanying Python integration script.

### Example Python Script

The following Python script demonstrates how to **fetch outbound SMS messages from the Musoni API** 
and forward them to an **external SMS gateway** for delivery (for example, Infobip or any other compatible SMS service provider).

This example includes:
- Basic authentication and tenant header support for the Musoni API  
- Integration logic for sending messages via a third-party SMS providerâs REST API or a **mock SMS gateway** (e.g., a local Docker service on port `8376`) for development and testing
- Polling and delivery status synchronization back to Musoni  
- Automatic retries with exponential backoff for network or server errors  

```python
import json
import time
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from typing import Any, Dict, Optional

import requests
from requests.auth import HTTPBasicAuth
from requests.exceptions import RequestException

# ========= Config =========
# Define your Infobip API credentials and endpoints
INFOBIP_API_BASE_URL = "http://exqq2.api.infobip.com/"
INFOBIP_API_KEY = "{{your_infobip_api_key}}"
SENDER = "{{your_infobip_sender_id}}"

# Musoni (Basic Auth)
MUSONI_API_URL = "{{musoni_api_base_url}}"
MUSONI_USERNAME = "{{musoni_username}}"
MUSONI_PASSWORD = "{{musoni_password}}"
MUSONI_TENANT = "{{musoni_tenant_identifier}}"
MUSONI_API_KEY = "{{musoni_api_key}}"

# Behavior
PAGE_SIZE = 10
VERIFY_SSL = False                 # keep False for local/self-signed dev only
SLEEP_INTERVAL = 5                 # seconds between status polls
MAX_POLL_SECONDS = 120             # max time to poll a single message
MAX_RETRIES = 5                    # HTTP retry attempts
BACKOFF_FACTOR = 1.5               # seconds base for exponential backoff

STATUS_TERMINAL = {"DELIVERED", "UNDELIVERABLE", "EXPIRED", "REJECTED"}
STATUS_TO_MUSONI = {
    "DELIVERED": 300,
    "SENT": 200,
    "PENDING": 200,
    "EXPIRED": 400,
    "REJECTED": 400,
    "UNDELIVERABLE": 400,
}

# ========= HTTP helper with retry/backoff =========
def request_with_retry(
    method: str,
    url: str,
    *,
    headers: Optional[Dict[str, str]] = None,
    params: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
    data: Optional[str] = None,
    auth: Optional[HTTPBasicAuth] = None,
    verify: bool = True,
    timeout: int = 30,
    ok_statuses: Optional[set] = None,
) -> requests.Response:
    ok_statuses = ok_statuses or {200}
    status_forcelist = {429, 500, 502, 503, 504}

    attempt = 0
    while True:
        attempt += 1
        try:
            resp = requests.request(
                method,
                url,
                headers=headers,
                params=params,
                data=data,
                auth=auth,
                verify=verify,
                timeout=timeout,
            )
            if resp.status_code in ok_statuses:
                return resp
            # Retry only for specific statuses
            if resp.status_code in status_forcelist and attempt < MAX_RETRIES:
                delay = BACKOFF_FACTOR ** attempt
                time.sleep(delay)
                continue
            # Non-retriable or out of retries
            return resp
        except RequestException as e:
            if attempt >= MAX_RETRIES:
                raise
            delay = BACKOFF_FACTOR ** attempt
            time.sleep(delay)

# ========= Musoni API =========
def retrieve_messages(offset: int = 0, limit: int = PAGE_SIZE) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    headers = {
        "Accept": "application/json",
        "X-Fineract-Platform-TenantId": MUSONI_TENANT,
        "x-api-key": MUSONI_API_KEY,
    }
    params = {
        "offset": offset,
        "limit": limit,
        "paged": True,
    }
    resp = request_with_retry(
        "GET",
        MUSONI_API_URL,
        headers=headers,
        params=params,
        auth=HTTPBasicAuth(MUSONI_USERNAME, MUSONI_PASSWORD),
        verify=VERIFY_SSL,
    )
    if resp.status_code != 200:
        raise Exception(f"Failed to retrieve messages: {resp.status_code} {resp.text}")
    return resp.json()

def update_message_status(
    musoni_message_id: int,
    infobip_message_id: str,
    infobip_status: str,
):
    musoni_status = STATUS_TO_MUSONI.get(infobip_status, 400)

    url = f"{MUSONI_API_URL}/{musoni_message_id}"
    headers = {
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
        "Accept": "application/json",
        "X-Fineract-Platform-TenantId": MUSONI_TENANT,
        "x-api-key": MUSONI_API_KEY,
    }
    payload = {
        "status": musoni_status,
        "externalId": infobip_message_id,
        "locale": "en_GB"
    }
    if infobip_status in ("SENT", "PENDING"):
        payload["sentOnDate"] = datetime.now().date().isoformat()
        payload["dateFormat"] = "yyyy-MM-dd"

    resp = request_with_retry(
        "PUT",
        url,
        headers=headers,
        data=json.dumps(payload),
        auth=HTTPBasicAuth(MUSONI_USERNAME, MUSONI_PASSWORD),
        verify=VERIFY_SSL,
        ok_statuses={200, 204},  # some APIs prefer 204 No Content on update
    )
    if resp.status_code not in (200, 204):
        raise Exception(f"Failed to update Musoni status: {resp.status_code} {resp.text}")
    print(f"Musoni message {musoni_message_id} updated -> {musoni_status} ({infobip_status}).")

# ========= Infobip (mock) API =========
def send_sms(recipient: str, message_text: str) -> str:
    url = f"{INFOBIP_API_BASE_URL}/sms/2/text/advanced"
    headers = {
        "Authorization": f"App {INFOBIP_API_KEY}",
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
        "Accept": "application/json",
    }
    payload = {
        "messages": [
            {
                "from": SENDER,
                "destinations": [{"to": recipient}],
                "text": message_text,
            }
        ]
    }
    resp = request_with_retry(
        "POST",
        url,
        headers=headers,
        data=json.dumps(payload),
        verify=VERIFY_SSL,
    )
    if resp.status_code != 200:
        raise Exception(f"Failed to send SMS: {resp.status_code} {resp.text}")
    data = resp.json()
    return data["messages"][0]["messageId"]

def check_sms_status(message_id: str) -> str:
    url = f"{INFOBIP_API_BASE_URL}/sms/1/reports"
    headers = {
        "Authorization": f"App {INFOBIP_API_KEY}",
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
        "Accept": "application/json",
    }
    params = {"messageId": message_id}
    resp = request_with_retry(
        "GET",
        url,
        headers=headers,
        params=params,
        verify=VERIFY_SSL,
    )
    if resp.status_code != 200:
        raise Exception(f"Failed to check SMS status: {resp.status_code} {resp.text}")
    data = resp.json()
    if not data.get("results"):
        return "PENDING"
    return data["results"][0]["status"]["groupName"]

# ========= Utils =========
def format_number_with_country_code(phone_number: str) -> str:
    """
    Normalize to E.164 for NL:
      06xxxxxxxx -> +316xxxxxxxx
      already +31... -> keep
    """
    num = phone_number.strip()
    if num.startswith("+"):
        return num
    digits = "".join(ch for ch in num if ch.isdigit())
    if digits.startswith("0"):
        digits = digits[1:]
    return "+31" + digits

# ========= Main =========
def main():
    try:
        offset = 0
        while True:
            data = retrieve_messages(offset=offset, limit=PAGE_SIZE)
            messages = data.get("pageItems", [])
            if not messages:
                print("No more messages to process.")
                break

            for msg in messages:
                musoni_message_id = msg["id"]
                recipient = format_number_with_country_code(msg["mobileNo"])
                message_text = msg["message"]

                # 1) Send via (mock) Infobip
                infobip_message_id = send_sms(recipient, message_text)
                print(f"Sent to {recipient} | Infobip ID: {infobip_message_id}")

                # 2) Poll with timeout + update Musoni at SENT and terminal
                start = datetime.now()
                seen_sent = False

                while True:
                    status = check_sms_status(infobip_message_id)
                    print(f"[{infobip_message_id}] status: {status}")

                    # Optional intermediate update when first seen as SENT
                    if status == "SENT" and not seen_sent:
                        update_message_status(musoni_message_id, infobip_message_id, status)
                        seen_sent = True

                    if status in STATUS_TERMINAL:
                        update_message_status(musoni_message_id, infobip_message_id, status)
                        break

                    # Max poll time guard
                    if (datetime.now() - start) > timedelta(seconds=MAX_POLL_SECONDS):
                        # Treat as failed/expired from our perspective
                        update_message_status(musoni_message_id, infobip_message_id, "EXPIRED")
                        print(f"[{infobip_message_id}] polling timed out after {MAX_POLL_SECONDS}s; marked EXPIRED.")
                        break

                    time.sleep(SLEEP_INTERVAL)

            offset += PAGE_SIZE

    except Exception as e:
        print(f"ERROR: {e}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main() 
```
âï¸ **Configuration Reminder**
Before running the script, make sure to replace all placeholder parameters (`{{...}}`) 
with your actual credentials and environment details.  

If youâre using a different SMS provider (e.g., Twilio, Vonage, or a mock Infobip Docker service on port `8376`), 
update the `INFOBIP_API_BASE_URL` and related fields accordingly.

This field is a system generated convenience field. It is generated by platform when groups are created. \
It uses _dot notation_ to define where an group stands in the group hierarchy. 

When a group is created with no parent it has a hierarchy value that matches its `id` e.g. '.12.'

When a group has a parent its hierarchy value matches its parents hierarchy + 'id.' e.g '.12.19.'

The hierarchy value is useful when you need to display groups in _hierarchy_ order.

GroupUpdateModel.description: The supported schema for updating a group.

name.description: The name of the group.

officeId.description: The `id` of the office that the group is associated with.

active.description: A boolean to indicate if this group should be created in active state. if true, `activationDate` needs to be supplied.

activationDate.description: The opening date in a date format supported by Joda Time.

submittedOnDate.description:
The date this group application was submitted in a date format supported by Joda Time.

If provided when creating the group and the group is set to `active`, the `submittedOnDate` is set to be the same as the `activationDate`.

accountNo.description:
A unique account no. which identifies this group.

If not provided on creation of the group, it is automatically generated based on the Account Number Format setup. (see Account Number Format and Configuration)

externalId.description:
A place to put an external reference for this group e.g. The ID another system uses for it. If provided, it must be unique. 

If not provided on creation of the group, it is automatically generated based on the Account Number Format setup. (see Account Number Format and Configuration)

clientMembers.description:
An array of integers that represent client ids. The clients provided must exist in the same office as group office.

There is also configurable rules around the min and max number of clients that are allowed when forming a group from existing clients.

items.description: An id of an existing client.

locale.description: The locale to use when interpreting number and date fields in the request.

dateFormat.description: The date format to use when interpreting date fields in the request. Must be suported by Joda Time.

GroupCommandTransferApi.description:
The command supports the ability to tranfer a group from one office to another.

All active loans and savings accounts directly associated with the group are transferred also.

All active loans and savings accounts associated with any of the groups active client members are transferred also.

Also supported is the ability to indicate the staff member that the client and/or group should be associated with.

destinationOfficeId.description:
The id of the office this group is to be associated with after the transfer.

It cannot be the same `officeId` as the group has already.

Note: The user making the request must have visibility of the source and destination office.

staffId.description:
The id of the staff member you wish the group and/or client members to be associated with after the transfer.

Note: The `staffId` must belong to the `destinationOfficeId`.

Note: The user making the request must have visibility of the source and destination office.

note.description: A note related to the requested transfer.

LoanStatus.description: The status of the loan based on the loan lifecycle (see loan lifecycle).

ClientRequestModel.description:
The supported schema for creating or updating a client member. 

`officeId` is mandatory when creating a client \
`fullname` or any of `firstname`, `middlename`, `lastname` must be provided as name for client \
`active` must be provided when creating a client, if true its possible client creation will fail if it is a member of a group and breaks group rules. \
`dateFormat` and `locale` are required even with no date fields at present.

officeId.description: The id of the office this client is associated with.

firstname.description: Facility to break up name into parts suitable for humans.

middlename.description: Facility to break up name into parts suitable for humans.

lastname.description: Facility to break up name into parts suitable for humans.

fullname.example: James Michael Patrick Anderson or ElectricBikes Ltd.
fullname.description: Facility to set name of a client or business that doesn't suit the firstname,middlename,lastname structure.

locale.description: The locale to use when interpreting number and date fields in the request.

dateFormat.description: The date format to use when interpreting date fields in the request. Must be suported by Joda Time.

active.description:
Indicates if this client should be created in `active` state on creation (status=300). 
If false, the client is created in a `pending` state (status=100).

Defaults to false if omitted.

activationDate.description:
The date the client account was activated. \
This is only used when `active` is true and the account goes straight into `active` state on creation. \
It must be provided in a date format supported by Joda Time and described by `dateFormat` parameter.

groupId.description: The id of the group this client is associated with.

staffId.description:
The id of the staff member dealing with the client office. \
The staff member is not specifically the loan officer.

isStaff.description: Indicates if this client is a staff member also.

genderId.description: The id of the code value related to the code `gender` (see Code and Code Values)

clientTypeId.description: The id of the code value related to the code `ClientType` (see Code and Code Values)

clientClassificationId.description: The id of the code value related to the code `ClientClassification` (see Code and Code Values)

savingsProductId.description: The id of the default overdraft savings account product this client is associated with.

legalFormId.description:
An integer representing the legal form of the client. 1 for Person, 2 for Entity
If provided and set to 2 (for Entity) then

tagIds.description: Tags are a way of classifying a client (see Tags for more details.)

accountNo.description:
If provided, its value is set as account no. for client account.
Otherwise an auto generated account no. is put in place based on the configured strategy. (see Configuration: Account Number Format)

If provided, it must be unique.

externalId.description: A place to put an external reference for this resource e.g. The ID another system uses for it. If provided, it must be unique.

dateOfBirth.description: The clients date of birth in a date format supported by Joda Time.

mobileNo.description:
Contact Details: The mobile telephone number of staff member.
If provided it must be unique. 
This mobile number maybe be used by SMS or Mobile Money functionality.

mobileNoSecondary.description: Contact Details; The secondary mobile telephone number of staff member.

emailAddress.description: Contact Details; The clients email address

submittedOnDate.description:
The date the client application was submitted. \
If not provided, this date will default to the systems today date. \
It must be provided in a date format supported by Joda Time and described by `dateFormat` parameter.

addressTypeId.description: The id of the code value related to the code `ADDRESS_TYPE` (see Code and Code Values)

ClientCommandTransferApi.description:
The command supports the following scenarios related to client transfers:

1. client is transfered from one office to another
2. client is member of group and is transfered to another group in same office
3. client is member of group and is transfered to another group in different office

All scenarios also support the ability to indicate the staff member that the client and/or group should be associated with.

destinationOfficeId.description:
The id of the office this client is to be associated with after the transfer.

It can be the same `officeId` as the client has in which case this transfer will not be an office transfer but a group transfer to group in same office.

Note: The user making the request must have visibility of the source and destination office.

destinationGroupId.description:
The id of the group this client is to be associated with after the transfer.

Optional but if this transfer is not to another branch, then this becomes required.

Note: The `destinationGroupId` must belong to the `destinationOfficeId`.

Note: The user making the request must have visibility of the source and destination office.

staffId.description:
The id of the staff member you wish the client and/or group to be associated with after the transfer.

Note: The `staffId` must belong to the `destinationOfficeId`.

Note: The user making the request must have visibility of the source and destination office.

note.description: A note related to the requested transfer.

isActive.description: Indicates if this client address is active or not.

countryId.description: Unique `id` of the code value representing a country

postalCode.description: Part of the address fields. Can be used to capture postcode of address
