LoanProductSearchResponseModel.description: The api response when searching for loan products

name.description: The full name of the loan product.

shortName.description:
The short name of the loan product.

An abbreviated version of the name, used in reports or menus where space is limited.

description.example: 12.5% Declining Balance
description.description: A description to provide	users	with more information	about	the	product.

externalId.description: A place to put an external reference for this resource e.g. The ID another system uses for it. If provided, it must be unique.

state.description: Enumeration type of loan product status

id.description: The id of the item in the Enumeration. Unique to the Enumeration.

code.description: A fixed code that can be used by api user for translation or localisation purposes.

value.description: The actual value of this enumeration option.

closed.description: Indicates if the status represents closed.

active.description: Indicates if the status represents active.

status.description:
Deprecated - use `state` instead.

The globalisation code related to the loan product status

startDate.description: The date the loan product is active from

closeDate.description: The date the loan product is closed on

fundId.description:
The id of associated fund source.

The original source of your funds (for example a grant).

fundName.description: The name of the fund associated with product.

productGroup.description: The product group associated with this product.

id.description: The id of associated product group.

name.description: The of the product group if one exists

type.description: The string value of the enumeration

installmentAmountInMultiplesOf.description:
Relates to the loan repayment schedule.

This will round the monetary amount of an installment to the nearest multiple.

Must be greater than or equal to `currency.inMultiplesOf` and if greater than it, a multiple of `currency.inMultiplesOf`.

principal.description:
The `principal` is the default amount that can be shown to users when creating a new loan via forms. 

Can be used with `minPrincipal` and `maxPrincipal` to put bounds on the size of loans that use this product.

Can be overridden at loan account creation time

minPrincipal.description:
The minimum size of any loan under this loan product.

See also `principal` and `maxPrincipal`.

maxPrincipal.description:
The maximum size of any loan under this loan product.

See also `principal` and `minPrincipal`.

numberOfRepayments.description:
The `numberOfRepayments` is the default number of installments that is shown to users when creating a new loan via forms.

Can be used with `minNumberOfRepayments` and `maxNumberOfRepayments` to put bounds on the number of installments allowed in loans that use this product.

Can be overridden at loan account creation time

minNumberOfRepayments.description:
The `minNumberOfRepayments` is the minimum number of installments allowed in loans that use this product.

See also `numberOfRepayments` and `maxNumberOfRepayments`.

maxNumberOfRepayments.description:
The `maxNumberOfRepayments` is the maximum number of installments allowed in loans that use this product.

See also `numberOfRepayments` and `minNumberOfRepayments`.

useRecurrencePattern.description:
Indicates if you are using recurrence pattern to describe the repayment frequency.

If true, `recurrencePatterns` will be provided and these will be used to describe the products repayment frequency instead of `repaymentEvery` and `repaymentFrequencyType`.

On products listing response we do not provide the `recurrencePatterns` details.

repaymentEvery.description: Used together with `repaymentFrequencyType` to indicate the length of time between installments.

id.description: The id of the item in the Enumeration. Unique to the Enumeration.

code.description: A fixed code that can be used by api user for translation or localisation purposes.

value.description: The actual value of this enumeration option.

allowFlexibleAdvancePayment.description: Setting: If true, enables a loan product with `isInterestRecalculationEnabled=false` to support interest recalculation on advance payments.

minimumDaysBetweenDisbursalAndFirstRepay.description: The minimum number of days allowed between a Loan disbursal and its first repayment.

firstRepaymentOffsetPeriod.description:
Deprecated: not supported.

`firstRepaymentOffsetPeriod` is used with `repaymentFrequencyType` to configure the offset of the first repayment date from the disbursement date. 
            
For example, if the `repaymentFrequencyType` is months, the disbursement date is set to the 5th of September, and the value 3 is entered, then the first repayment date will become 5th of December.

See also `repaymentFrequencyType`.

isLinkedToFloatingInterestRates.description:
Deprecated: Floating interest rates are not supported at present.

A boolean that indicates if the product is using the "floating" interest rates concept or not.

If false, `interestRatePerPeriod`, `interestRateFrequencyType` and `minInterestRatePerPeriod`, `maxInterestRatePerPeriod` are applicable.

If true, `floatingRatesId`, `interestRateDifferential`, `minDifferentialLendingRate`, `maxDifferentialLendingRate`, `defaultDifferentialLendingRate` and `isFloatingInterestRateCalculationAllowed` are applicable.

isFloatingInterestRateCalculationAllowed.description:
Deprecated: Floating interest rates are not supported at present.

A boolean that indicates if floating interest rate is enabled.

interestRatePerPeriod.description:
The default interest rate shown to user that create loans via forms.

Can be used with `minInterestRatePerPeriod` and `maxInterestRatePerPeriod` to put bounds on the interest rate allowed in loans that use this product.

Used with `interestRateFrequencyType` to describe the interest rate.

Mandatory if `isLinkedToFloatingInterestRates` is false.

minInterestRatePerPeriod.description:
The minimum interest rate allowed in loans that use this product.

See also `interestRatePerPeriod` and `maxInterestRatePerPeriod`.

maxInterestRatePerPeriod.description:
The maximum interest rate allowed in loans that use this product.

See also `interestRatePerPeriod` and `minInterestRatePerPeriod`.

interestRateFrequencyType.description:
Used together with `interestRatePerPeriod` to indicate the length of time the interest is applicable to.

Supported options are:
2=Months
3=Years

Mandatory if `isLinkedToFloatingInterestRates` is false.

annualInterestRate.description: The nominal annual interest rate figure based on `interestRatePerPeriod` and `interestRateFrequencyType`

interestType.description:
Relates to the `Interest Calculation`. 

Dictates how the the interest is calculated for the loan schedule.

Supported options are:
0=Declining Balance
1=Flat

Flat Interest loans charge equal interest amounts on each loan instalment, based on the original loan principal.

Declining Balance loans calculate the interest amount on each instalment based upon the outstanding balance of the loan (therefore the interest amount charged on each instalment reduces as the loan is repaid).

interestCalculationPeriodType.description:
Relates to the the repayment schedule. 

Dictates how the the interest is calculated for the loan schedule.

Supported options are:
0=Daily
1=Same as repayment period

Defaults to 1="Same as Repayment Period". This ensures that all loans of the same loan term have the same interest amount charged over the course of the loan.

Selecting 0="Daily" means that the interest amount charged on a loan product will vary slightly based on the number of days in the months over which the loan term runs.

allowPartialPeriodInterestCalcualtion.description:
Only Applicable if `interestCalculationPeriodType` = 1 (Same as Repayment Period)

Used to calculate interest for partial periods. 

Example: Interest charged from is 5th of April , Principal is 10000 and interest is 1% per month then the interest will be (10000 * 1%)* (25/30), 
it calculates for the month first then calculates exact periods between start date and end date(can be a decimal)

amortizationType.description:
Relates to the the repayment schedule. 

Dictates how the the loan is amortized over the loan schedule.

Supported options are:
0=Equal Principal
1=Equal Installments

Mandatory and only relevant if `interestType`=0 (Declining Balance).

Selecting 0=Equal Principal ensures that the principal of the loan installment remains the same through the loan term (with the interest and installment size therefore declining).

Selecting 1=Equal Installments ensures the principal is adjusted to ensure equal installment sizes.

daysInYearType.description:
An enumeration that indicates the number of days in year to be used.

This determines whether the daily interest rate is calculated by dividing the `annualInterestRate` by 360, or 365.

Supported options are:
1=Actual
360=360
364=364
365=365

daysInMonthType.description:
An enumeration that indicates the number of days in month to be used.

Specifies the number of days in a Month, used to calculate partial periods for monthly loans.

Supported options are:
1=Actual
30=30

graceOnPrincipalPayment.description: If populated, indicates the number of installments you wish your grace period on principal payments to be.

recurringMoratoriumOnPrincipalPeriods.description: Deprecated - was used with grace fields such as `graceOnPrincipalPayment` to determin number of periods that principal was not required

graceOnInterestPayment.description: If populated, indicates the number of installments you wish your grace period on interest payments to be.

graceOnInterestCharged.description: If populated, indicates the number of installments you wish there to be no interest charged / calculated for.

graceOnPrincipalAndInterestPayment.description: Related to attribute overrides for loans. see `allowAttributeOverrides`

graceOnArrearsAgeing.description: Related to attribute overrides for loans. see `allowAttributeOverrides`

canDefineInstallmentAmount.description:
Setting. if true, then fixed installment amount can be provided on loan account.

Relates to fixed emi feature of loans.

principalThresholdForLastInstallment.description: Setting. If provided, it is used in fixed emi scenario if needing to adjust the last installments principal value

syncExpectedWithDisbursementDate.description: Setting. if true, it is used to validate that the expected dibursement date of a loan account is the same as its actual disbursement date

taxOnIncome.description: The tax group details associated with this product.

name.description: The name of tax group

transactionProcessingStrategyId.description:
An `id` of the transaction or payment processing strategy to be used when payments are made against loan.

This relates to functionality that is also known as Payment Application Logic.

A number of out of the box approaches exist and custom approaches can be added if required.

Determines the order in which Interest, Principal, Penalties and Fees are paid off when repayments are made.

Supported options are:
1=Stanard (Penalties, Fees, Interest, Principal order)
5=Principal, Interest, Penalties, Fees Order
6=Interest, Principal, Penalties, Fees Order

transactionProcessingStrategyName.description: The name of the transaction processing strategy in use for this product

allowVariableInstallments.description:
Use 'allowVariableInstallments' if you wish to be able to change the repayment schedule.

Example - if `minimumGap` = 1, `maximumGap` = 10 and installment 1 due date = 01-06-2019, \
then installment 2 due date must be between 01-06-2019 and 11-06-2019

If true, then `minimumGap`, `maximumGap` are mandatory

minimumGap.description: Mandatory if `allowVariableInstallments` is true, used to indicate the minimum number of days the adjusted repayment schedule can be away from original.

maximumGap.description: Mandatory if `allowVariableInstallments` is true, used to indicate the maximum number of days the adjusted repayment schedule can be away from original.

repayPrincipalEvery.description: Related to `Multiple Balloon Repayments` concept. If provided and greater than zero, used to force principal to be paid every [`repayPrincipalEvery`] installments.

repayInterestEvery.description: Related to `Multiple Balloon Repayments` concept.If provided and greater than zero, used to force interest to be paid every [`repayInterestEvery`] installments.

isInterestRecalculationEnabled.description:
Mandatory and only applicable if `interestType` = 0 (Declining Balance). 

Used to denote whether interest recalculation is enabled or disabled. When a client falls into arrears, additional interest will be recalculated. 

On declining balance loans interest is always calculated across the new loan term.

recalculateInterestOnArrears.description: Only Applicable if `isInterestRecalculationEnabled` = 1 determines if interest recalculation should occur on installments in arrears.

id.description: The id of interest recalculation settings

productId.description: The id of the loan product

interestRecalculationCompoundingType.description:
Mandatory and only applicable if `isInterestRecalculationEnabled` is true.

Only supported if `interestCalculationPeriodType` is Daily and `allowPartialPeriodInterestCalcualtion` is true
Or
if `interestCalculationPeriodType` is not Daily and `allowPartialPeriodInterestCalcualtion` is false

Supported options are:
0=None
1=Interest
2=Fee
3=Interest and Fee

When a client falls into arrears, additional interest is calculated. 

Use this setting to determine whether the new interest amount is calculated on fees, interest or fees & interest.

code.description: The globalisation code of compounding method in use

value.description: The english value of the globalisation code

rescheduleStrategyType.description:
Mandatory and only applicable if `isInterestRecalculationEnabled` is true.

Supported options are:
1=Reschedule next repayments
2=Reduce number of installements
3=Reduce installment amount (Reduce EMI Amount)

Select 2="Reduce number of installments" if you wish the loan to finish earlier in the case of early repayments

Select 3="Reduce installment amount" if you wish the interest due on future installments to be reduced in the case of early repayments.

2=Daily
3=Weekly

Use 3=weekly for the previous week
Use 4=monthly for the previous month. 

Using 0=Same as Repayment period will use the repayment frequency of the loan itself.

if true, the system will stop calculating additional (penalty) interest on loans in arrears once the total interest, fees and penalties outstanding is the same as the outstanding principal. 

This only applies to interest recalculation loans.

accountMovesOutOfNPAOnlyOnArrearsComplet.description: if true, loan account moves out of NPA state only when all arrears are cleared

holdGuaranteeFunds.description:
If true, a guarantor will not be able to withdraw funds linked as a guarantee to the loan until the loan is repaid.

if true, see `mandatoryGuarantee`.

productId.description: The id of the loan product

mandatoryGuarantee.description:
Mandatory and only applicable if `holdGuaranteeFunds` is true.

This is the percentage of the loan that has to be guaranteed before the loan can be created.

minimumGuaranteeFromOwnFunds.description: This is the minimum percentage that has to be guaranteed from the client's own savings, rather than the savings of other guarantors.

minimumGuaranteeFromGuarantor.description: This is the minimum percentage that any other guarantors have to guarantee for the loan to be created.

splitInterestAmongGuarantors.description:
Mandatory and only applicable if `holdGuaranteeFunds` is true.

If true, then when the loan is fully repaid, the interest from the loan will be paid into each guarantor's savings account in proportion to the percentage of the loan they guaranteed.

canAutoAllocateOverpayments.description:
If true then if the loan is overpaid, the overpaid amount will be automatically transferred to the linked savings account. 

If there is no linked savings account, the overpaid amount has to be transferred manually. This will also apply to already active accounts.

graceOnPrincipalAndInterestPayment.description: If true, allows the user to define custom grace period during loan account creation.

standingInstruction.description: If true, allows the user to define a standing instruction during loan account creation

allowAdditionalCharges.description: If false, when adding or editing loans with this product users will not be allowed to add additional charges to the loan.

allOf.description: The supported schema for creating a loan product

name.description: The full name of the loan product.

shortName.description:
The short name of the loan product.

An abbreviated version of the name, used in reports or menus where space is limited.

description.example: 12.5% Declining Balance
description.description: A description to provide	users	with more information	about	the	product.

productGroupId.description: The id of associated product group.

fundId.description:
The id of associated fund source.

The original source of your funds (for example a grant).

loanIncomeTaxGroupId.description:
The id of associated TaxGroup to be used for tax on loan income.

If provided, it means that loan accounts created against this product will support tax on their income.

Only supported when the Periodic Accruals accounting is configured `accountingRule=3`.

if provided, `interestTaxOnLoanAccountId` should also be supplied so Tax on Interest can be booked against it.

currencyCode.description: Relates to the the	currency of the loan product. A three character identifer of currency this loan product uses.

digitsAfterDecimal.description: Relates to the the	currency of the loan product. The number of digits after decimal to be supported on the currency.

inMultiplesOf.description: Relates to the the	currency of the loan product. Relevant for currencies where digitsAfterDecimal is zero. This will round the monetary amount to the nearest multiple.

installmentAmountInMultiplesOf.description:
Relates to the loan repayment schedule.

This will round the monetary amount of an installment to the nearest multiple.

Must be greater than or equal to `inMultiplesOf` and if greater than it, a multiple of `inMultiplesOf`.

principal.description:
The `principal` is the default amount that can be shown to users when creating a new loan via forms. 

Can be used with `minPrincipal` and `maxPrincipal` to put bounds on the size of loans that use this product.

Can be overridden at loan account creation time

minPrincipal.description:
The minimum size of any loan under this loan product.

See also `principal` and `maxPrincipal`.

maxPrincipal.description:
The maximum size of any loan under this loan product.

See also `principal` and `minPrincipal`.

numberOfRepayments.description:
The `numberOfRepayments` is the default number of installments that is shown to users when creating a new loan via forms.

Can be used with `minNumberOfRepayments` and `maxNumberOfRepayments` to put bounds on the number of installments allowed in loans that use this product.

Can be overridden at loan account creation time

minNumberOfRepayments.description:
The `minNumberOfRepayments` is the minimum number of installments allowed in loans that use this product.

See also `numberOfRepayments` and `maxNumberOfRepayments`.

maxNumberOfRepayments.description:
The `maxNumberOfRepayments` is the maximum number of installments allowed in loans that use this product.

See also `numberOfRepayments` and `minNumberOfRepayments`.

repaymentEvery.description: Used together with `repaymentFrequencyType` to indicate the length of time between installments.

repaymentFrequencyType.description:
Used together with `repaymentEvery` to indicate the length of time between installments.

Supported options are:
0=Days
1=Weeks
2=Months
3=Years

isLinkedToFloatingInterestRates.description:
A boolean that indicates if the product is using the "floating" interest rates concept or not.

if false, `interestRatePerPeriod`, `interestRateFrequencyType` and `minInterestRatePerPeriod`, `maxInterestRatePerPeriod` are applicable.

if true, `floatingRatesId`, `interestRateDifferential`, `minDifferentialLendingRate`, `maxDifferentialLendingRate`, `defaultDifferentialLendingRate` and `isFloatingInterestRateCalculationAllowed` are applicable.

interestRatePerPeriod.description:
The default interest rate shown to user that create loans via forms.

Can be used with `minInterestRatePerPeriod` and `maxInterestRatePerPeriod` to put bounds on the interest rate allowed in loans that use this product.

Used with `interestRateFrequencyType` to describe the interest rate.

Mandatory if `isLinkedToFloatingInterestRates` is false.

minInterestRatePerPeriod.description:
The minimum interest rate allowed in loans that use this product.

See also `interestRatePerPeriod` and `maxInterestRatePerPeriod`.

maxInterestRatePerPeriod.description:
The maximum interest rate allowed in loans that use this product.

See also `interestRatePerPeriod` and `minInterestRatePerPeriod`.

interestRateFrequencyType.description:
Used together with `interestRatePerPeriod` to indicate the length of time the interest is applicable to.

Supported options are:
2=Months
3=Years

Mandatory if `isLinkedToFloatingInterestRates` is false.

floatingRatesId.description: The id on a floating rate entry on the system.

interestRateDifferential.description: The difference between the base rate and this loan products floating interest rate.

minDifferentialLendingRate.description: The min allowed difference between the base rate and this loan products floating interest rate.

maxDifferentialLendingRate.description: The max allowed difference between the base rate and this loan products floating interest rate.

defaultDifferentialLendingRate.description: The default difference between the base rate and this loan products floating interest rate.

isFloatingInterestRateCalculationAllowed.description: A boolean that indicates if floating interest rate caclulation is allowed.

repayPrincipalEvery.description: Related to `Multiple Balloon Repayments` concept. If provided and greater than zero, used to force principal to be paid every [`repayPrincipalEvery`] installments.

repayInterestEvery.description: Related to `Multiple Balloon Repayments` concept.If provided and greater than zero, used to force interest to be paid every [`repayInterestEvery`] installments.

firstRepaymentOffsetPeriod.description:
`firstRepaymentOffsetPeriod` is used with `repaymentFrequencyType` to configure the offset of the first repayment date from the disbursement date. 

For example, if the `repaymentFrequencyType` is months, the disbursement date is set to the 5th of September, and the value 3 is entered, then the first repayment date will become 5th of December.

See also `repaymentFrequencyType`.

allowVariableInstallments.description:
Use 'allowVariableInstallments' if you wish to be able to change the repayment schedule.

Example - if `minimumGap` = 1, `maximumGap` = 10 and installment 1 due date = 01-06-2019, \
then installment 2 due date must be between 01-06-2019 and 11-06-2019

If true, then `minimumGap`, `maximumGap` are mandatory

minimumGap.description: Mandatory if `allowVariableInstallments` is true, used to indicate the minimum number of days the adjusted repayment schedule can be away from original.

maximumGap.description: Mandatory if `allowVariableInstallments` is true, used to indicate the maximum number of days the adjusted repayment schedule can be away from original.

graceOnPrincipalPayment.description: If populated, indicates the number of installments you wish your grace period on principal payments to be.

graceOnInterestPayment.description: If populated, indicates the number of installments you wish your grace period on interest payments to be.

graceOnInterestCharged.description: If populated, indicates the number of installments you wish there to be no interest charged / calculated for.

graceOnPrincipalAndInterestPayment.description: Related to attribute overrides for loans. see `allowAttributeOverrides`

graceOnArrearsAgeing.description: Related to attribute overrides for loans. see `allowAttributeOverrides`

standingInstruction.description: Deprecated. if passed as direct parameter not processed or used. Related to attribute overrides for loans. see `allowAttributeOverrides`

allowAdditionalCharges.description:
If false, when adding or editing loans with this product users will not be allowed to add additional charges to the loan. 

Deprecated. if passed as direct parameter not processed or used. Related to attribute overrides for loans. see `allowAttributeOverrides`

canUseForTopup.description: if true, a new loan of this product type is allowed to top-up an existing loan of the client.

interestType.description:
Relates to the `Interest Calculation`. 

Dictates how the the interest is calculated for the loan schedule.

Supported options are:
0=Declining Balance
1=Flat

Flat Interest loans charge equal interest amounts on each loan instalment, based on the original loan principal.

Declining Balance loans calculate the interest amount on each instalment based upon the outstanding balance of the loan (therefore the interest amount charged on each instalment reduces as the loan is repaid).

isInterestRecalculationEnabled.description:
Mandatory and only applicable if `interestType` = 0 (Declining Balance). 

Used to denote whether interest recalculation is enabled or disabled. When a client falls into arrears, additional interest will be recalculated. 

On declining balance loans interest is always calculated across the new loan term.

interestCalculationPeriodType.description:
Relates to the the repayment schedule. 

Dictates how the the interest is calculated for the loan schedule.

Supported options are:
0=Daily
1=Same as repayment period

Defaults to 1="Same as Repayment Period". This ensures that all loans of the same loan term have the same interest amount charged over the course of the loan.

Selecting 0=Daily means that the interest amount charged on a loan product will vary slightly based on the number of days in the months over which the loan term runs.

allowPartialPeriodInterestCalcualtion.description:
Only Applicable if `interestCalculationPeriodType` = 1 (Same as Repayment Period)

Used to calculate interest for partial periods. 

Example: Interest charged from is 5th of April , Principal is 10000 and interest is 1% per month then the interest will be (10000 * 1%)* (25/30), 
it calculates for the month first then calculates exact periods between start date and end date(can be a decimal)

recalculateInterestOnArrears.description: Only Applicable if `isInterestRecalculationEnabled` = 1 determines if interest will be recalculated on arrears.

interestRecalculationCompoundingMethod.description:
Mandatory and only applicable if `isInterestRecalculationEnabled` is true.

Only supported if `interestCalculationPeriodType` is Daily and `allowPartialPeriodInterestCalcualtion` is true
Or
if `interestCalculationPeriodType` is not Daily and `allowPartialPeriodInterestCalcualtion` is false

Supported options are:
0=None
1=Interest
2=Fee
3=Interest and Fee

When a client falls into arrears, additional interest is calculated. 

Use this setting to determine whether the new interest amount is calculated on fees, interest or fees & interest.

rescheduleStrategyMethod.description:
Mandatory and only applicable if `isInterestRecalculationEnabled` is true.

Supported options are:
1=Reschedule next repayments
2=Reduce number of installements
3=Reduce installment amount (Reduce EMI Amount)

Select 2="Reduce number of installments" if you wish the loan to finish earlier in the case of early repayments

Select 3="Reduce installment amount" if you wish the interest due on future installments to be reduced in the case of early repayments.

recalculationRestFrequencyType.description:
Mandatory and only applicable if `isInterestRecalculationEnabled` is true.

Supported options are:
1=Same as repayment period
2=Daily
3=Weekly
4=Monthly

Use 2=Daily if you wish interest to be calculated on the outstanding loan balance from the previous day.
Use 3=weekly for the previous week
Use 4=monthly for the previous month. 

Using 0=Same as Repayment period will use the repayment frequency of the loan itself.

preClosureInterestCalculationStrategy.description:
Optional and only applicable if `isInterestRecalculationEnabled` is true.

Supported options are:
1=TILL_PRE_CLOSURE_DATE
2=TILL_REST_FREQUENCY_DATE

When a customer pays off a loan ahead of schedule and not on the due date of the installment, \n
this option controls whether the interest is calculated on the date of the transaction, \n
or uses interest as per the end date of the current installment.

inDuplum.description:
Optional and only applicable if `isInterestRecalculationEnabled` is true.

if true, the system will stop calculating additional (penalty) interest on loans in arrears once the total interest, fees and penalties outstanding is the same as the outstanding principal. 

This only applies to interest recalculation loans.

amortizationType.description:
Relates to the the repayment schedule. 

Dictates how the the loan is amortized over the loan schedule.

Supported options are:
0=Equal Principal
1=Equal Installments

Mandatory and only relevant if `interestType`=0 (Declining Balance).

Selecting 0=Equal Principal ensures that the principal of the loan installment remains the same through the loan term (with the interest and installment size therefore declining).

Selecting 1=Equal Installments ensures the principal is adjusted to ensure equal installment sizes.

daysInYearType.description:
An enumeration that indicates the number of days in year to be used.

This determines whether the daily interest rate is calculated by dividing the âNominal Annual Interest Rateâ by 360, or 365.

Supported options are:
1=Actual
360=360
364=364
365=365

daysInMonthType.description:
An enumeration that indicates the number of days in month to be used.

Specifies the number of days in a Month, used to calculate partial periods for monthly loans.

Supported options are:
1=Actual
30=30

transactionProcessingStrategyId.description:
An `id` of the transaction or payment processing strategy to be used when payments are made against loan.

This relates to functionality that is also known as Payment Application Logic.

A number of out of the box approaches exist and custom approaches can be added if required.

Determines the order in which Interest, Principal, Penalties and Fees are paid off when repayments are made.

Supported options are:
1=Stanard (Penalties, Fees, Interest, Principal order)
5=Principal, Interest, Penalties, Fees Order
6=Interest, Principal, Penalties, Fees Order

holdGuaranteeFunds.description:
If true, a guarantor will not be able to withdraw funds linked as a guarantee to the loan until the loan is repaid.

if true, see `mandatoryGuarantee`.

mandatoryGuarantee.description:
Mandatory and only applicable if `holdGuaranteeFunds` is true.

This is the percentage of the loan that has to be guaranteed before the loan can be created.

minimumGuaranteeFromOwnFunds.description: This is the minimum percentage that has to be guaranteed from the client's own savings, rather than the savings of other guarantors.

minimumGuaranteeFromGuarantor.description: This is the minimum percentage that any other guarantors have to guarantee for the loan to be created.

splitInterestAmongGuarantors.description:
Mandatory and only applicable if `holdGuaranteeFunds` is true.

If true, then when the loan is fully repaid, the interest from the loan will be paid into each guarantor's savings account in proportion to the percentage of the loan they guaranteed.

canAutoAllocateOverpayments.description:
If true then if the loan is overpaid, the overpaid amount will be automatically transferred to the linked savings account. 

If there is no linked savings account, the overpaid amount has to be transferred manually. This will also apply to already active accounts.

autoDisburse.description: If true, newly created loans will automatically be approved and disbursed.

checkNumber.description: Optional and only applicable if `autoDisburse` is true

restrictSavingsProductId.description:
The `id` of an existing savings product.

Linked savings account will then be required to be associated with this selected savings product.

requiresLinkedSavingsAccount.description: Used to indicate if a linked savings account is required or not.

requiresMandatorySavings.description: Optional and only applicable if `requiresLinkedSavingsAccount` is true.

mandatorySavingsMethod.description: Mandatory and only applicable if `requiresMandatorySavings` is true.

mandatorySavingsPercentage.description: Mandatory and only applicable if `requiresMandatorySavings` is true.

minimumDaysBetweenDisbursalAndFirstRepay.description: The minimum number of days allowed between a Loan disbursal and its first repayment.

canDefineInstallmentAmount.description: if true, then fixed installment amount can be provided from loan account.

overdueDaysForNPA.description: Represents the maximum number of days a loan may be overdue before being classified as a NPA (non performing asset)

accountMovesOutOfNPAOnlyOnArrearsComplet.description: if true, loan account moves out of NPA state only when all arrears are cleared

includeInBorrowerCycle.description: Used to denote whether the loans should include in loan cycle counter or not.

useBorrowerCycle.description: Used to denote whether the loans should depend on borrower loan cycle counter or not.

principalVariationsForBorrowerCycle.description: Variations for loan, based on borrower cycle number

interestRateVariationsForBorrowerCycle.description: Variations for loan, based on borrower cycle number

numberOfRepaymentVariationsForBorrowerCy.description: Variations for loan, based on borrower cycle number

allowFlexibleAdvancePayment.description: use for non-interest recalculation product to allow interest recalculation on advance payment.

allowAdditionalCharges.description: If false, when adding or editing loans with this product users will not be allowed to add additional charges to the loan.

amortizationType.description: If true, allows the `amortizationType` to be changed for loans under this product.

interestType.description: If true, allows the `interestType` to be changed for loans under this product.

interestCalculationPeriodType.description: If true, allows the `interestCalculationPeriodType` to be changed for loans under this product.

repaymentEvery.description: If true, allows the user to override the `repaymentEvery` setting during loan account creation.

transactionProcessingStrategyId.description: If true, allows the user to select a different transaction processing strategy during loan account creation.

graceOnPrincipalAndInterestPayment.description: If true, allows the user to define custom grace period during loan account creation.

standingInstruction.description: If true, allows the user to define a standing instruction during loan account creation

accountingRule.description:
Indicates what type of accounting is enabled for this loan product.

Supported options are:
1=None
2=Cash Based Accounting
3=Accrual Periodic
4=Accrual Upfront

interestTaxOnLoanAccountId.description:
The `id` of a GL account.

This GL account is used to book tax on interest when the tax feature is setup for loans and `Periodic Accrual` accounting is used.

LoanResponseModel.description: The standard response provided for query requests against Loans API

accountNo.description: The generated unique account number for this loan.

externalId.description: A place to put an external reference for this resource e.g. The ID another system uses for it. If provided, it must be unique.

status.description: The status of the loan based on the loan lifecycle (see loan lifecycle).

clientId.description: Unique `id` representing the linked client resource.

clientAccountNo.description: The generated unique account number for the linked loan.

clientName.description: The name of the loan as it will be displayed.

clientOfficeId.description: Unique `id` representing the linked office resource.

loanProductName.description: The unique name of the product

loanProductDescription.example: Mobile loan for repeat customers with max limit of 10,000

loanOfficerId.description: Unique `id` representing the staff member linked to the loan.

loanOfficerName.description: Display name from the staff member linked to the loan.

loanType.description: The status of the loan based on the loan lifecycle (see loan lifecycle).

principal.description: The principal amount of the loan used on the contract and for calculations.

approvedPrincipal.description: The principal amount that was approved for disbursement. If this is a tranche loan not all principal needs to be disbursed at any stage.

proposedPrincipal.description: The principal amount that was originally requested by customer (can be higher-lower than actual) for disbursement.

termFrequency.description: The length of loan term. Used like: loanTermFrequency loanTermFrequencyType, eg 12 months.

termPeriodFrequencyType.description:
Classifies the frequency type of the loan, combined with termFrequency this is the length of the loan contract: eg 12 (termFrequency) months
Example Values: 0=Days, 1=Weeks, 2=Months, 3=Years

id.description: The unique id of a the enumeration

code.description: A unique code that can be used for localisation and internalisation.

value.description: The text value of the enumeration

numberOfRepayments.description: The number of payments the customer needs to make, this is not necesserily the same as the termFrequency. Eg on a 12 month loan repayments could be 6 with repaymentEvery (below) being 2

repaymentFrequencyType.description:
Classifies the repayment freqency type of the loan, combined with repaymentFrequencyType this is the length of the loan contract: eg 12 (termFrequency) months
Example Values: 0=Days, 1=Weeks, 2=Months, 3=Years

id.description: The unique id of a the enumeration

code.description: A unique code that can be used for localisation and internalisation.

value.description: The text value of the enumeration

interestRatePerPeriod.description: interest rate for the loan, which is applied per period (specified in interestRateFrequencyType)

interestRateFrequencyType.description:
Classifies the interest freqency type of the loan, between annual and monthly:
Example Values: 2=Per month, 3=Per year

id.description: The unique id of a the enumeration

code.description: A unique code that can be used for localisation and internalisation.

value.description: The text value of the enumeration

annualInterestRate.description: Annualised interest rate, based on interestRateFrequencyType and interestRatePerPeriod

amortizationType.description:
Specifies whether the loan uses equal instalments (P+I) or equal principal instalments.
1 = Equal instalments
2 = Equal principal

id.description: The unique id of a the enumeration

code.description: A unique code that can be used for localisation and internalisation.

value.description: The text value of the enumeration

interestType.description:
Specifies whether the interest calculation methodology.     
- 0 = Declining Balance
- 1 = Flat interest

id.description: The unique id of a the enumeration

code.description: A unique code that can be used for localisation and internalisation.

value.description: The text value of the enumeration

interestCalculationPeriodType.description:
Specifies how interest will be calculated.     
- 0 = Daily
- 1 = Same as repayment period

Example: Using daily interest each  monthly instalment will have a different interest amount based on days in that month

Daily: Annual Rate / Days in year * days in month
Same as repayment: Annual Rate / Periods in Year (eg 12)

id.description: The unique id of a the enumeration

code.description: A unique code that can be used for localisation and internalisation.

value.description: The text value of the enumeration

allowPartialPeriodInterestCalcualtion.description: If enabled and the interestCalculationPeriodType = Same as repayment period, then any odd period due to holidays or the first period will be calculated as a partial period

transactionProcessingStrategyId.description:
An enumeration that indicates the type of transaction processing strategy to be used. This relates to functionality that is also known as Payment Application Logic.

Currently supported strategies:
1 - Penalties, Fees, Interest, Principal order (Default)
5 - Principal, Interest, Penalties, Fees Order
6 - Interest, Principal, Penalties, Fees Order

transactionProcessingStrategyName.description: See transactionProcessingStrategyId for explanation on the different strategies used and available.

expectedFirstRepaymentOnDate.description: The date the loan application was submitted; structured as an array of date parts including year, month, day.

timeline.description: Contains important date related to the lifecycle of the loan

submittedOnDate.description: The date the loan application was submitted; structured as an array of date parts including year, month, day.

submittedByUsername.description: The username of the user that submitted the loan application on the system.

submittedByFirstname.description: The first name of the user that submitted the loan application on the system.

submittedByLastname.description: The last name of the user that submitted the loan application on the system.

expectedDisbursementDate.description: The date the loan account is expected to be Disbursed; structured as an array of date parts including year, month, day.

expectedMaturityDate.description: The date the loan account is expected to be paid off; structured as an array of date parts including year, month, day.

multiDisburseLoan.description: If true then the loan can have multiple disbursement tranches (tranche loan).

canDefineInstallmentAmount.description: If true then the loan can have custom/fixed instalment amounts overriding the system calculations. Use this with care to avoid errors where the total monthly payment will not be large enough to cover both principal and interest components.

canDisburse.description: Validates for tranche loans whether a next tranche can be disbursed on the loan given the previous disbursements and current date.

canUseForTopup.description: If true then the loan can be used for a topup of another loan.

isTopup.description: If true then the current loan is a topup of another loan, which is specified under the closureLoanId field

stopApplyingPenalty.description: If true then the current loan is will not have overdue installment penalty added to it

closureLoanId.description: Unique `id` representing the loan that was closed using the current loan as the topUp.

inArrears.description: True if the loan is currently in in arrears

isNPA.description: True if the loan is currently classified as NPA , this is based on product config and can also mean that interest recalculation loans will no longer accrue further interest.

daysInMonthType.description:
Specifies the number of days in a month.
Example Values:
- 1=ACTUAL(Actual number of days in month) 
- 30=30 DAYS

id.description: The unique id of a the enumeration

code.description: A unique code that can be used for localisation and internalisation.

value.description: The text value of the enumeration

daysInYearType.description:
Specifies the number of days in a year.
Example Values:
- 1=ACTUAL(Actual number of days in year)
- 360=360 DAYS
- 364=364 DAYS(52 WEEKS) 
- 365=365 DAYS

id.description: The unique id of a the enumeration

code.description: A unique code that can be used for localisation and internalisation.

value.description: The text value of the enumeration

isInterestRecalculationEnabled.description: Indicates whether or not interest will be recalculated after each payment or other loan event (arrears etc)

recalculateInterestOnArrears.description: Only Applicable if `isInterestRecalculationEnabled` = 1 determines if interest will be recalculated on arrears.

createStandingInstructionAtDisbursement.description: If true then the field LinkedSavingsAccount will also be present indicating which savingsaccount is linked to the loan. A standing instruction will be created that will link the 2 together for paying off the loan instalments

isVariableInstallmentsAllowed.description: If true a loan can have completely customizable instalments and schedule specified in a loanTermVariantions object.

internalRateOfReturn.description: This is the APR calculation for the loan taking into account annualized rates

effectiveInterestRate.description: The EIR uses is based off APR but also takes into account compounding of interest and unequal periodic lengths.

repayPrincipalEvery.description: Allows for balloon schedules where  principal is only paid every X instalments, similar to the repayEvery param.

repayInterestEvery.description: Allows for balloon schedules where interest is only paid every X instalments, similar to the repayEvery param.

isInDuplum.description: In cases of recalculating interest and high interest rate there is a possibility where the total interest on the loan has equaled the total principal. At this stage new interest will no longer be calculated.

officeId.description: id of the office under which this loan is currently linked.

officeName.description: Name of the office under which this loan is currently linked

originChannel.description:
The originChannel value as submitted at creation.

Freetext loan origination channel to be used to designate where the loan calls were initiated from, to then later be used in the loan appraisal (or reporting) process.

LoanChargeCreateNew.description: A loan charge is an instance of a charge definition applied to a loan.

chargeId.description: The `id` of an existing charge definition.

amount.description:
The charge amount. Providing this will override its property as on charge definition.

The `amount` is interpreted as a percentage or monetary amount based on the definition of the associated charge definition.

Used in combination with `chargeCalculationType` parameter. e.g 1 % of Amount or 3.50 Flat

chargeTimeType.description:
Used to determine at what time or stage of the loan lifecycle the charge is applied.

Providing this will override its property as on charge definition.

Supported options are:
1=Disbursement
2=Specified Due Date (see `dueDate`)
8=Installment Fee
13=Disbursement Paid with Repayment
14=Loan Rescheduling Fee
15=Overdue on Maturity
20=Last Installment Fee
21=Quarterly Fee
40=Disbursement Added To Principal

chargeCalculationType.description:
Used to determine the calculation type performed.

Providing this will override its property as on charge definition.

Supported options are:
1=Flat
2=% of Principal Due
3=% of Principal + Interest due (on installment?)
4=% of Interest due on installment
5=% of Disbursement amount
6=% of Total Outstanding Loan Principal
7=% of Original Loan Principal
8=Percentage of Original Loan Principal per Installment
9=Disbursement Added To Principal
10=% of Original Loan Amount Spread over Installments (Deprecated?)
11=% of savings balance

dueDate.description:
The proposed due date for the charge.

Providing this will override its property as on charge definition.

Only applicable if `chargeTimeType=2`.

LoanCollateralCreateNew.description:
In lending agreements, collateral is a borrower's pledge of specific property to a lender, to secure repayment of a loan. 

The collateral serves as protection for a lender against a borrower's default - that is, any borrower failing to pay the principal and interest under the terms of a loan obligation. 

If a borrower does default on a loan (due to insolvency or other event), that borrower forfeits (gives up) the property pledged as collateral - and the lender then becomes the owner of the collateral.

id.description: The `id` of an existing loan collateral.

value.description: The market value of the collateral.

type.description: The id of a code value that relates to the loan collateral code `LoanCollateral` (see Code and Code Values).

description.example: A short description of collateral entry.
description.description: A discription of the collateral entry.

LoanCommandCreateLoan.description:
The supported schema for creating a loan. 

Use `command=calculateLoanSchedule` to return a proposed loan schedule based on same terms.

loanType.description:
This fields indicates the type of loan that is being applied for.

Three types of loans are supported at present:
- individual - (loans where a single person or business applies for loan)
- group (loans where several persons group together to receive loan)
- jlg (loans where several persons group together and are jointly liable for entire loan)

clientId.description:
The `id` of an existing client this loan is for.

Mandatory when `loanType=individual`.

Impact on repayment schedule:

If `reschedule-repayments-on-holidays` configuration is enabled. The `clientId` is used to pick up the office associated with the existing client and determine what holidays are applicable.

groupId.description:
The `id` of an existing group this loan is for.

Mandatory when `loanType=group` or `loanType=jlg`.

Impact on repayment schedule:

If `reschedule-repayments-on-holidays` configuration is enabled. The `groupUd` is used to pick up the office associated with the existing group and determine what holidays are applicable.

calendarId.description:
The `id` of a calendar entry. 

Applicable only to JLG loans and where configuration is enabled for `meetings-mandatory-for-jlg-loans`.

syncDisbursementWithMeeting.description:
A boolean indicating if disbursement date should be fall in with the groups meeting date.

Applicable only to JLG loans and where configuration is enabled for `meetings-mandatory-for-jlg-loans`.

principal.description: The `principal` is the amount of the loan that is to be disbursed.

loanTermFrequency.description: Used together with `loanTermFrequencyType` to indicate the term of the loan.

loanTermFrequencyType.description:
Used together with `loanTermFrequency` to indicate the term of the loan.

Supported options are:
0=Days
1=Weeks
2=Months
3=Years

numberOfRepayments.description: The `numberOfRepayments` is the number of installments for this loan.

repaymentEvery.description: Used together with `repaymentFrequencyType` to indicate the length of time between installments.

repaymentFrequencyType.description:
Used together with `repaymentEvery` to indicate the length of time between installments.

Supported options are:
0=Days
1=Weeks
2=Months
3=Years

When months option is selected two futher fields are relevant and can be optionally provided; `repaymentFrequencyNthDayType` and `repaymentFrequencyDayOfWeekType`

repaymentFrequencyNthDayType.description:
Used together with `repaymentFrequencyDayOfWeekType` to indicate on what frequency the repayment should be made.

It supports frequencies like: First Monday (of the month).

Only applicable when `repaymentFrequencyType=2`.

Supported options are:
1=First
2=Second
3=Third
4=Fourth

repaymentFrequencyDayOfWeekType.description:
Used together with `repaymentFrequencyNthDayType` to indicate on what frequency the repayment should be made.

It supports frequencies like: First Monday (of the month).

Only applicable when `repaymentFrequencyType=2`.

Supported options are:
1=Monday
2=Tuesday
3=Wednesday
4=Thursday
5=Friday
6=Saturday
7=Sunday

interestType.description:
Relates to the `Interest Calculation`. 

Dictates how the interest is calculated for the loan schedule.

Supported options are:
0=Declining Balance
1=Flat

Flat Interest loans charge equal interest amounts on each loan instalment, based on the original loan principal.

Declining Balance loans calculate the interest amount on each instalment based upon the outstanding balance of the loan (the interest amount charged on each instalment reduces as the loan is repaid).

interestCalculationPeriodType.description:
Relates to the repayment schedule. 

Dictates how the interest is calculated for the loan schedule.

Supported options are:
0=Daily
1=Same as repayment period

Defaults to 1="Same as Repayment Period". This ensures that all loans of the same loan term have the same interest amount charged over the course of the loan.

Selecting 0=Daily means that the interest amount charged on a loan product will vary slightly based on the number of days in the months over which the loan term runs.

interestRatePerPeriod.description:
The interest rate per selected period type.

Used with `interestRateFrequencyType` to describe the interest rate.

interestRateFrequencyType.description:
Used together with `interestRatePerPeriod` to indicate the length of time the interest is applicable to.

Supported options are:
2=Months
3=Years

If omitted, the loan inherits this property from its Loan Product.
if provided, it overrides any property that is set in Loan Product.

amortizationType.description:
Relates to the the repayment schedule. 

Dictates how a declining balance loan is amortized over the loan schedule.

Supported options are:
0=Equal Principal
1=Equal Installments

Mandatory and only relevant if `interestType`=0 (Declining Balance).

Selecting 0=Equal Principal ensures that the principal of the loan installment remains the same through the loan term (with the interest and installment size therefore declining).

Selecting 1=Equal Installments ensures the principal is adjusted to ensure equal installment sizes.

transactionProcessingStrategyId.description:
An `id` of the transaction processing strategy to be used when repayments or other transactions are made against loan.

This relates to functionality that is also referred to elsewhere in documentation as Payment Application Logic.

A number of out of the box approaches exist and custom approaches can be added if required.

The key responsiblity of the strategy is to determines the order in which Interest, Principal, Penalties and Fees are paid off when repayments are made. 

Supported options are:
1=Standard (Penalties, Fees, Interest, Principal order)
5=Principal, Interest, Penalties, Fees Order
6=Interest, Principal, Penalties, Fees Order

expectedDisbursementDate.description:
The proposed disbursement date for the loan.

Provided as a string and used together with `dateFormat`.

submittedOnDate.description:
The date on which the loan application was submitted for approval.

Provided as a string and used together with `dateFormat`.

locale.description: The locale to use when interpreting number and date fields in the request.

dateFormat.description: The date format to use when interpreting date fields in the request. Must be suported by Joda Time.

submittedOnNote.example: Loan application completed and submitted for approval by manager.

repaymentsStartingFromDate.description:
Related to `Loan Schedule Generation` algorithm.

When provided, the loan schedule is generated using this date as the first repayment date due date.

see also loan product setting `minimumDaysBetweenDisbursalAndFirstRepayment`.

Provided as a string and used together with `dateFormat`.

graceOnPrincipalPayment.description:
Related to `Loan Schedule Generation` algorithm.

If populated, indicates the number of installments you wish your grace period on principal payments to be.

e.g 1 means that the first installment of the loan schedule will have no principal due.

graceOnInterestPayment.description:
Related to `Loan Schedule Generation` algorithm.

If populated, indicates the number of installments you wish your grace period on interest payments to be.

e.g 1 means that the first installment of the loan schedule will have no interest due.

graceOnInterestCharged.description:
Related to `Loan Schedule Generation` algorithm.

If populated, indicates the number of installments you wish there to be no interest charged / calculated for.

e.g 1 means that interest will only begin being calculated based on the principal outstanding from installment two.

fundId.description:
The id of associated fund source.

The original source of your funds (for example a grant).

loanOfficerId.description: The id of associated staff member that is a loan officer.

loanPurposeId.description: The id of a code value that relates to the loan purpose code (see Code and Code Values).

linkAccountId.description:
The `id` of an existing savings account.

Linked savings account will then be required to be associated with the selected client and also any product restriction setup on loan product.

charges.description:
Ability to add multiple loan charges to the loan in one at time of creation.

Applicable only when the loan product is configured to allow this. see `allowAttributeOverrides` on loan product.

collateral.description: Ability to add multiple loan collateral entries to the loan at time of creation.

accountNo.description:
A unique account no. which identifies the account for this loan.

If not provided on creation, it is automatically generated based on the Account Number Format setup. (see Account Number Format and Configuration)

externalId.description: A place to put an external reference for this loan e.g. The ID another system uses for it. If provided, it must be unique.

allowPartialPeriodInterestCalcualtion.description: Only Applicable if `interestCalculationPeriodType` = 1 (Same as Repayment Period)

createStandingInstructionAtDisbursement.description:
A boolean indicating if a standing instruction should be created on disbursement for the repayments.

Applicable only when the loan product is configured to allow this. see `allowAttributeOverrides` on loan product.

interestChargedFromDate.description:
The date from which interest is to be calculated from.

Provided as a string and used together with `dateFormat`.

When the loan is disbursed, there is an option on disbusrsement known as `syncInterestChargedFromDateWithActualDisbursementDate` which will set the date to be the same as the actual disbursement date. 

Global confiruation related to this field:
- `interest-charged-from-date-same-as-disbursal-date`

DataFilterResponseParameter.description: A parameter that is to be returned in response of data filter.

ordinal.description: An integer that indicates the display order of the field in the response

name.description:
The name of the api parameter that to be included in the response. 

The name must be a valid api parameter name from the data filters metadata model.

DataFilterSortByParameter.description: A parameter that dictates the sort order of the data filter response.

ordinal.description: An integer that indicates in order this parameter is applied as sorting if other parameters are defined.

name.description:
The name of the api parameter to which the sort will be applied. 

The name must be a valid api parameter name from the data filters metadata model.

direction.description: The direction of sort to be applied, Ascending (ASC) or Descending (DESC) order

LoanQuerySearchByState.description: The request parameters for searching for loans by state.

stateName.description: Used to find loans that match this state name exactly. The state name should match one of the states defined in the state machine.

officeId.description: Used in addition to `stateName` to refine the loan search based on selected office.

loanOfficerId.description: Used in addition to `stateName` to refine the loan search based on selected loan officer.

responseParameters.description: Specifies which fields the search should return.

sortByParameters.description: Specifies how the search results should be sorted.

note.example: A short note in relation to this.
note.description: An optional comment or note in relation to this command.

Used when `command` query parameter is set to `withdrawnByApplicant`.

withdrawnOnDate.description:
The date on which the loan application was withdrawn.

Provided as a string and used together with `dateFormat`.

allOf.description:

The date on which the loan application was rejected.

Provided as a string and used together with `dateFormat`.

allOf.description:

Used when `command` query parameter is set to `undoreject`.

Used when `command` query parameter is set to `approve`.

Provided as a string and used together with `dateFormat`.

Used when `command` query parameter is set to `undoapprove`.

accountNumber.description: An account number related to payment

checkNumber.description: The check number related to payment

routingCode.description: The routing code related to payment

receiptNumber.description: The receipt number related to payment

bankNumber.description: The bank number related to payment

allOf.description:
The supported schema for disbursing a loan to a client or group.

Used when `command` query parameter is set to `disburse`.

actualDisbursementDate.description:
The date on which the loan application was disbursed.

Provided as a string and used together with `dateFormat`.

transactionAmount.description:
The amount of money disbursed.

Omitting this, the disbursement will use the `approvedPrincipal` of the loan.

externalId.description: A place to put an external reference for this disbursement transaction e.g. The ID another system uses for it. If provided, it must be unique.

syncInterestChargedFromDateWithActualDis.description: When set to `true`, the `interestChargedFromDate` property of a loan is set to have the same date as the `actualDisbursementDate` of the loan.

adjustRepaymentDate.description:
Sets the `repaymentsStartingFromDate` property of a loan to the date provided.

Provided as a string and used together with `dateFormat`.

allOf.description:
The supported schema for disbursing a loan with funds being disbursed to linked savings account.

Used when `command` query parameter is set to `disburseToSavings`.

actualDisbursementDate.description:
The date on which the loan application was disbursed.

Provided as a string and used together with `dateFormat`.

transactionAmount.description:
The amount of money disbursed.

Omitting this, the disbursement will use the `approvedPrincipal` of the loan.

externalId.description: A place to put an external reference for this disbursement transaction e.g. The ID another system uses for it. If provided, it must be unique.

syncInterestChargedFromDateWithActualDis.description: When set to `true`, the `interestChargedFromDate` property of a loan is set to have the same date as the `actualDisbursementDate` of the loan.

allOf.description:
The supported schema for undoing a `disburse` or `disburseToSavings` command on a loan application.

Used when `command` query parameter is set to `undodisbursal`.

The supported schema for loan repayment.

Used when `command` query parameter is set to `repayment`.

The date on which the repayment was made.

Provided as a string and used together with `dateFormat`.

LoanTransactionCommandModel.description: The commands that can be performed over a loan transaction instance.

SavingsInterestRateChartWithNoSlabs.description: An interest rate chart that can be associated with savings products.

name.description: A unique name associated with the interest rate chart.

description.example: multi-band interest rate chart
description.description: A description to provide	users	with more information	about	the	interest rate chart.

fromDate.description:
Date from when the chart is valid. 

The `fromDate` is mandatory and used to find out applicable interest rate chart for accounts. 

There should not be any overlapping of `fromDate` and `endDate` of charts for a product.

endDate.description:
Validity end date of the chart. 

This is optional, if not provided means it is the current chart applicable.

annualInterestRate.description: The interest rate to be applicable based on `fromDate` and `toDate` provided. e.g from 2022-01-01 to 2022-12-31 the rate is 9.75%

locale.description: The locale to use when interpreting number and date fields in the request.

name.description: The full name of the product.

shortName.description:
The short name of the product.

An abbreviated version of the name, used in reports or menus where space is limited.

description.example: 6 month fixed deposit with monthly compounding
description.description: A description to provide	users	with more information	about	the	product.

currencyCode.description:
A three character identifer of currency.
The currency of the product.

digitsAfterDecimal.description: Relates to the the	currency of the product. The number of digits after decimal to be supported on the currency.

inMultiplesOf.description: Relates to the the	currency of the product. Relevant for currencies where `digitsAfterDecimal` is zero. This will round the monetary amount to the nearest multiple.

productGroupId.description: The id of associated product group.

nominalAnnualInterestRate.description:
Simple way of describing the interest rate as a nominal APR to use for interest calculation e.g. 5% Per annum

If not suitable for product it can be set to zero and `interestRateCharts` can be used to create an interest rate chart that will decide the rate.

interestPostingPeriodType.description:
Part of interest calculation settings. 

Indicates how often interest is to be posted to the account.

Supported options are:
4=Monthly
5=Quarterly
6=Bi-Annualy
7=Annual

interestCompoundingPeriodType.description:
Part of interest calculation settings. 

Indicates how often interest is to be compounded.

Supported options are:
1=Daily
4=Monthly
5=Quarterly
6=Bi-Annualy
7=Annual

interestCalculationType.description:
Part of interest calculation settings. 

There are two methods to calculate the interest on a savings account:
1=Daily Balance
2=Average Balance

interestCalculationDaysInYearType.description:
Part of interest calculation settings. 

Supported options are:
1=360
2=365

minBalanceForInterestCalculation.description:
Part of interest calculation settings.

The mimimum balance of the savings account for interest calculation to be permitted.

withHoldTax.description:
A boolean that indicates if withholding tax is configured.

if `true` interest posted to accounts of this product with have a withholding tax applied based on amount of interest posted.

The withholding tax is shown as an additional transaction on the account.

taxGroupId.description:
The id of associated tax group.

Required if `withHoldTax` is set to true.

lockinPeriodEnabled.description:
A boolean that indicates if lockin period feature is to be used by this product and accounts of this product.

if `true`, `lockinPeriodFrequency` and `lockinPeriodFrequencyType` should be provided and these properties will be used when creating a savings account (unless overridden at that stage).

if `false`,`lockinPeriodFrequency` and `lockinPeriodFrequencyType` should be left null or not passed at all in the request.

lockinPeriodFrequency.description: If provided, used along with `lockinPeriodFrequencyType` to indicate the length of time after opening that the account is 'locked' and withdrawals of any amount are not permitted e.g. 2 Months

lockinPeriodFrequencyType.description:
If provided, used along with `lockinPeriodFrequency` to indicate the length of time after opening that the account is 'locked' and withdrawals of any amount are not permitted e.g. 2 Months

Supported options are:
0=Days
1=Weeks
2=Months
3=Years

minRequiredOpeningBalance.description:
Related to account activation.

Specifies the mimimum balance that savings accounts of this product must have upon activation.

When the account is activated, it will auto create a deposit transaction for the `minRequiredOpeningBalance`.

enforceMinRequiredBalance.description:
Indicates that `minRequiredBalance` is verified on savings accounts of this product.

Used together with `minRequiredBalance` to describe the minimum allowed balance of this product.

if enabled, then attempts to withdraw amounts that result in the account balance falling below `minRequiredBalance` will not be permitted.

minRequiredBalance.description:
Mandatory if `enforceMinRequiredBalance` is true.

Specifies the mimimum balance that savings accounts of this product must have whilst active.

if `enforceMinRequiredBalance` enabled, then attempts to withdraw amounts that result in the account balance falling below `minRequiredBalance` will not be permitted.

allowOverdraft.description: Indicates if an overdraft facility is be allowed on savings accounts of this product.

overdraftLimit.description:
Mandatory if `allowOverdraft` is true.

Specifies the  amount of overdraft that savings accounts of this product can have must be between minOverdraftLimit and maxOverdraftLimit.

minOverdraftLimit.description:
Mandatory if `allowOverdraft` is true.

Specifies the minimum amount of overdraft that savings accounts of this product can have.

maxOverdraftLimit.description:
Mandatory if `allowOverdraft` is true.

Specifies the maximum amount of overdraft that savings accounts of this product can have.

nominalAnnualInterestRateOverdraft.description: Interest rate as a nominal APR to use for interest calculation when account is in overdraft e.g. 20% Per annum must be between min and max nominalAnnualInterestRateOverdraft

minNominalAnnualInterestRateOverdraft.description: Minimum Interest rate as a nominal APR to use for interest calculation when account is in overdraft e.g. 20% Per annum

maxNominalAnnualInterestRateOverdraft.description: Maximum Interest rate as a nominal APR to use for interest calculation when account is in overdraft e.g. 20% Per annum

minOverdraftForInterestCalculation.description:
Applicable if `allowOverdraft` is true.

If provided, indicates how much into an overdraft before interest is calculated against the overdraft.

isDormancyTrackingActive.description: Indicates if accounts of this product should support movement to dormant status by end of day scheduled jobs.

daysToInactive.description:
Mandatory if `isDormancyTrackingActive` is true.

If provided, indicates how many days before the account should be considered inactive.

daysToDormancy.description:
Mandatory if `isDormancyTrackingActive` is true.

If provided, indicates how many days before the account should be considered dormant.

daysToEscheat.description:
Mandatory if `isDormancyTrackingActive` is true.

If provided, indicates how many days before the account should be considered escheat.

calculateInterestDuringDormancy.description:
Mandatory if `isDormancyTrackingActive` is true.

Indicates if interest should be calculated for accounts that are marked as dormant.

stopInterestIfDormant.description:
Duplicate of `calculateInterestDuringDormancy`.

Applicable if `isDormancyTrackingActive` is true.

Indicates if interest should be calculated for accounts that are marked as dormant.

enableWithdrawalNotice.description: Indicates if notice is required for withdrawals.

noticePeriod.description:
Mandatory if `enableWithdrawalNotice` is true.

If provided, indicates how many days notice required prior to withdrawal.

validationPeriod.description:
Mandatory if `enableWithdrawalNotice` is true.

If provided, indicates how many days ???.

withdrawalFeeForTransfers.description: Indicates if fee applied for withdrawals.

monthDayFormat.description: Joda time compatile date format for day-month used by `feeOnMonthDay`.

feeOnMonthDay.description: describe day and month of annual fee `feeAmount` using `monthDayFormat`.

charges.description: The set of charge definitions applicable to this product.

minimumNegativeBalance.description:
Must be less than zero.

TBC

maximumPositiveBalance.description:
Must be greater than zero.

TBC

accountingRule.description:
Indicates what type of accounting is enabled for this product.

Supported options are:
1=None
2=Cash Based Accounting

Used along with `lockinPeriodFrequencyType` to indicate the length of time that the fixed deposit account is 'locked in' and premature closure is not allowed. e.g. 2 Months

If provided it overrides the setting on the product, otherwise the account inherits from the product.

lockinPeriodFrequencyType.description:
If provided, overrides the same named setting from product.

If the savings product `lockinPeriodEnabled` is false then this should not be null or not passed in the reqeust.

Used along with `lockinPeriodFrequency` to indicate the length of time that the fixed deposit account is 'locked in' and premature closure is not allowed. e.g. 2 Months

If provided it overrides the setting on the product, otherwise the account inherits from the product.

Supported options are:
0=Days
1=Weeks
2=Months
3=Years

chartId.description:

If omitted, then an applicable interest rate chart will be looked for on the associated product based on the `submittedOnDate`.

autoRenewOnClosure.description: A boolean that indicates if accounts of this product should be renewed upon reaching maturity.

preClosurePenalInterest.description: The interest rate to use in case of pre-closure e.g. 5% Per annum

preClosurePenalInterestOnTypeId.description:
Indicates how the `preClosurePenalInterest` is to be applied.

Supported options are:
1=Whole Term
2=Until Premature Withdrawal

Related to dividend calculation.

The minimum number of days (as minimumActivePeriodFrequencyType only permits 'Days') a share purchase transaction must exist for before being included in dividend calculation.

This parameter is used together with `lockPeriodTypeEnum` to indicate this length of time.

lockPeriodTypeEnum.description:
An enumeration that indicates the period frequency of the lock-in period.

The lock-in period is the minimum amount of time that a member is required to own the shares before they can redeem the shares.

This parameter is used together with `lockinPeriod` to indicate this length of time.

id.description: The unique id of a the enumeration

code.description: A unique code that can be used for localisation and internalisation.

value.description: The text value of the enumeration

recurrenceInterval.description: Used in combination with `recurrenceType` to describe the interval at which the standing instruction is executed. e.g every 1 Month(s)

recurrenceOnMonthDay.description:
If `recurrenceFrequency` is Months, is used to indicates the day of the month the instruction is scheduled to be executed on.

Used in combination with `recurrenceInterval` and  `recurrenceType` to describe the interval at which the standing instruction is executed. e.g every 1 Month(s) on 4th

recurrenceOnLastDayOfMonth.description:
If `recurrenceFrequency` is Months, is used to indicate the recurrence will fall of the last day of the month that matches the recurrence.

When used, `recurrenceOnMonthDay` is not used.

Used in combination with `recurrenceInterval` and  `recurrenceType` to describe the interval at which the standing instruction is executed. e.g every 1 Month(s) on Last day of Month.

GLAccountRequestModel.description: The supported schema when creating a new general ledger account (GL Account).

name.description: The name of the GL account

glCode.description: The ledger code associated with the Account. These codes are mandatory and unique

type.description:
Classifies the account into one of the following Types: 

1=Asset: represent the different types of economic resources owned or controlled by business, common examples of Asset accounts are cash, cash in bank, building, inventory, prepaid rent, goodwill, accounts receivable \
2=Liability: represent the different types of economic obligations by a business, such as accounts payable, bank loan, bonds payable \
3=Equity: represent the residual equity of a business (after deducting from Assets all the liabilities) including Retained Earnings and Appropriations \
4=Income: represent the company's gross earnings and common examples include Interest Income, Sales and Service revenue \
5=Expense: represent the company's expenditures to enable itself to operate. Common examples are electricity and water, rentals, depreciation, doubtful accounts, insurance. \

usage.description:
Indicates if this ledger is a Header or Detail ledger account.

1=Detail: "Detail" accounts may have transactions logged against them \
2=Header: "Header" accounts specify the title of a group of accounts. They are used only for grouping together detail accounts that have a similar purpose; that is, detail accounts are assigned to specific header accounts

manualEntriesAllowed.description: Indicates if manual entries can be made against this account using the Journals API.

parentId.description: To assign a another GL account as the parent of this GL account.

disabled.description: Indicates whether an account is disabled or not.

reconciliationEnabled.description: Indicates if reconcillation is allowed to be calculated for this account

tagId.description: A code value related to GL accounts used for tagging the account heads, based on GLAccount types.

description.example: Some text explaining the GL account.
description.description: Human understandable description for the general ledger account

externalId.description: A place to put an external reference for this resource e.g. The ID another system uses for it. If provided, it must be unique.

glCode.description: The ledger code associated with the Account. These codes are mandatory and unique

type.description:
Classifies the account into one of the following Types: 

1=Asset: represent the different types of economic resources owned or controlled by business, common examples of Asset accounts are cash, cash in bank, building, inventory, prepaid rent, goodwill, accounts receivable \
2=Liability: represent the different types of economic obligations by a business, such as accounts payable, bank loan, bonds payable \
3=Equity: represent the residual equity of a business (after deducting from Assets all the liabilities) including Retained Earnings and Appropriations \
4=Income: represent the company's gross earnings and common examples include Interest Income, Sales and Service revenue \
5=Expense: represent the company's expenditures to enable itself to operate. Common examples are electricity and water, rentals, depreciation, doubtful accounts, insurance. \

usage.description:
Indicates if this ledger is a Header or Detail ledger account.

1=Detail: "Detail" accounts may have transactions logged against them \
2=Header: "Header" accounts specify the title of a group of accounts. They are used only for grouping together detail accounts that have a similar purpose; that is, detail accounts are assigned to specific header accounts
