JournalEntryResponseModel.description:
Represents a journal entry in the general ledger system.

Journal entries record financial transactions using double-entry bookkeeping principles.
Each entry represents either a debit or credit to a specific GL account.

id.description: Unique identifier for the journal entry

officeId.description: ID of the office/branch where the entry was posted

glAccountType.description: Type of GL account (Asset, Liability, Income, Expense, Equity)

transactionDate.description: Date of the transaction in [year, month, day] format

entryType.description: Type of journal entry (Debit or Credit)

transactionId.description: Transaction identifier linking related journal entries

manualEntry.description: Indicates if this is a manual entry (true) or system-generated (false)

entityType.description: Type of entity associated with the entry (Client, Group, Loan, Savings, etc.)

createdByUserId.description: ID of the user who created the entry

createdDate.description: Date when the entry was created in [year, month, day] format

createdByUserName.description: Username of the user who created the entry

comments.description: Comments or notes for the journal entry

reversed.description: Indicates if this entry has been reversed

referenceNumber.description: Reference number for the journal entry

officeRunningBalance.description:
Running balance for the GL account within the specific office/branch.
Only includes transactions from the same branch.
Available when runningBalance=true parameter is used.

organizationRunningBalance.description:
Running balance for the GL account across the entire organization.
Includes transactions from all branches.
Available when runningBalance=true parameter is used.

runningBalanceComputed.description: Indicates if running balances have been computed for this entry

isReconciled.description: Bank reconciliation status of the journal entry

transactionDetails.description:
Detailed transaction information including payment details.
Available when transactionDetails=true parameter is used.

JournalEntryCreateModel.description:
Request model for creating a balanced journal entry.

Journal entries must follow double-entry bookkeeping principles where the sum of debits
equals the sum of credits. The system validates this balance before accepting the entry.

JournalEntryReverseModel.description:
Request model for reversing a journal entry.

Reversal creates offsetting journal entries that cancel out the original entries
while maintaining a complete audit trail.

Must be equal to or after the original transaction date.

OfficeResponseModel.description: The standard response provided for query requests against Offices API

nameDecorated.description: The name of the office padded with dots to show hierarchy

externalId.description: A place to put an external reference for this office e.g. The ID another system uses for it. If provided, it must be unique.

hierarchy.description:
This field is a system generated convenience field. It is generated by platform when offices are created. \
It uses _dot notation_ to define where an office stands in the office hierarchy. \

For example, the system default office (id = 1) has a hierarchy value of `.` An office (id = 12) placed directly underneath this default office has a hierarchy value of `.12.` \
And if a further office (id = 78) is placed directly under office (id = 12) its hierarchy value is `.12.78.` \

The hierarchy value is useful when you need to display offices in _hierarchy_ order (perhaps indented in a drop down list box).

This can be used by client application developers to decide if this `resource` should appear on an menu or section of screen.

DocumentTemplateResponseModel.description: The standard response provided for document templates

name.description: The name of document template.

entity.description: The base entity this document template is linked to, when running the template a resourceId of the same base entity should be passed (eg a clientId for a client template)

type.description: Document templates can be categorised according to usage, most templates are referred to as documents at this time.

text.example:
Loan Schedule

{{#or (eq loan.status.value "Submitted and pending approval") (eq loan.status.value "Approved")}}
text.description: text body of the template including mappers to be replaced.

mapperOrder.description: the order in which mappers will be executed (lowest first). can be used to pass on inherited params downstream (eg loan.clientId from initial mapper to subsequent client mapper etc)

mapperKey.description: The reference key by which the mapper is known within the scope of all other mappers. Returned values can be referred as mapperKey.<property>

mapperValue.description: The API call that is being made by the mapper, can be either relative to the baseUrl (as in example) or an external endpoint.

paperSize.description: Papersize on which the template would be printed, this will be sent along in the HTML headers and is picked up by most modern when printing.

isSystemDefined.description: A boolean indicated whether a template has been provided as a system defined template, these are mostly intended to be copied and then re-used in a customer specific context.

DocumentTemplateRequestModel.description: The supported schema for creating/updating a document template.

name.description: The name of the template

entity.description:
A categorisation type for the template based on core entity types in the system:

- 0 - client
- 1 - loan
- 2 - runreports
- 3 - savingsaccount 
- 4 - fixeddepositaccount
- 5 - generic
- 6 - group
- 7 - share
- 8 - sharetransaction
- 9 - loantransaction
- 10 - savingstransaction
- 11 - fixeddeposittransaction

type.description:
A categorisation type for the template based on usage type:

- 0 - document
- 1 - sms

paperSize.description:
A enumeration type for the template to indicate page size / orientation for template rendering:

- 0 - A4
- 1 - Legal
- 2 - Letter
- 3 - A5 
- 4 - A4 Landscape
- 5 - A5 Landscape

isSystemDefined.description: Indicates if this template is system defined or not

mappers.description: An array of mapper details which are APIs that can be trigger to provide content to the template

mappersorder.description: The order in which this mapper API is executed when processing

mapperskey.description: A namespace that the response of the mapper API is bundled under and can be accessed in template via this namespace

mappersvalue.description:
The mapper api URL. It must contain the tenantIdentifier query parameter. 

Placehoders variables such as {{loanId}} and {{tenantIdentifier}} will be populated based on the context/scope provided to template

tenantIdentifier.description: The identifier of the tenant running the template.

tenantUrl.description: The external FQDN of the customers environment, used for referring to logo's etc.

Status of the request, following status are being used:

parentId.description: The `id` of the parent GL account.

nameDecorated.description: The name of the GL account but decorated if within a GL hierarchy

disabled.description: Indicates whether an account is disabled or not.

manualEntriesAllowed.description: Indicates if manual entries can be made against this account using the Journals API.

type.description:
Classifies the account into one of the following Types: 

1=Asset: represent the different types of economic resources owned or controlled by business, common examples of Asset accounts are cash, cash in bank, building, inventory, prepaid rent, goodwill, accounts receivable \
2=Liability: represent the different types of economic obligations by a business, such as accounts payable, bank loan, bonds payable \
3=Equity: represent the residual equity of a business (after deducting from Assets all the liabilities) including Retained Earnings and Appropriations \
4=Income: represent the company's gross earnings and common examples include Interest Income, Sales and Service revenue \
5=Expense: represent the company's expenditures to enable itself to operate. Common examples are electricity and water, rentals, depreciation, doubtful accounts, insurance. \

code.description: A code that represents this enum value

value.description: The value of this code

usage.description:
Indicates if this ledger is a Header or Detail ledger account.

1=Detail: "Detail" accounts may have transactions logged against them \
2=Header: "Header" accounts specify the title of a group of accounts. They are used only for grouping together detail accounts that have a similar purpose; that is, detail accounts are assigned to specific header accounts

code.description: A code that represents this enum value
